', 'This is a mostly remote position, however, the candidate should reside near the Woodlands office location, with the ability to report on-site on short notice* Job Summary/PurposeThe Data Governance Lead is a senior member of the Enterprise Data and Analytics group with a focus on implementing the data/information governance strategies to ensure the data in the data lake is trustworthy for business/decision analytics. Some of the key responsibilities include:  Enhance and implement data governance framework across the Enterprise including data quality, data catalog, data privacy and security, data integrity and access control utilizing the necessary IT solutions and/or external services   Serve as a liaison between the business and IT to ensure that data related requirements are clearly defined, prioritized, and well understood   Proactively champion the value of information (data) as a strategic business asset and revenue generator by providing the business and strategy teams with ideas and promoting those ideas into action; including developing and implementing communication, learning, change management and adoption plans   Create and maintain DG policies, playbook(s), processes, procedures for guiding various data management processes, including adoption of data security and privacy, data quality control and data dissemination activities   Assist in developing and communicating usage methods and the availability of the data assets built by the team which will impact Entergy’s generation assets, load resources, customer view, and product and services offered to the customer.   Align data management practices with regulatory requirements  The Data Governance Business Lead is a resource who understands various data ingestions/manipulation technologies and can work collaboratively with the technical teams including data engineers, data scientists and business units to help solve their analytical needs.Job Duties/Responsibilities  Play a lead role in the creation, maintenance and monitoring of the DG policies, processes, procedures and playbook(s) for guiding the data management aspects of the Enterprise Data Lake   Guide the business users in curating the data catalog, business glossary, identify opportunities for data quality improvements, and manage privacy and access control issues   Conduct data governance discussions at the working group level to onboard the data stewards and owners, resolve governance/process related issues and escalate as needed   Serve as a business lead to enable the data consumers in the adoption of the data catalog and business glossary and engage the data stewards to improve data quality   Create and track KPIs to manage adoption, process improvements and data quality improvements   Be a champion for Entergy’s Analytics efforts both inside and outside of the organization, promoting collaboration and communication through business unit driven use cases whilst building the Entergy brand in the analytics space.  Minimum Requirements Education required of the position   B.S. Degree in a data-centric field (Economics, Computer Science or other science field), Information Systems, Information Processing or engineering.   Desired : M.S. in economics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, finance, engineering or other analytical field  Experience Required Of The Position  5+ years of experience as a business analyst enabling business intelligence and analytics in a fortune 500 company   2+ years of experience in project management using agile methodologies   1+ years of experience as a data governance professional include data stewardship, data quality, data catalog, data privacy, access control and master data management   Desired : 2+ years’ experience working in the electric and/or gas utility sector  Skills And Abilities Required Of The Position  Advanced SQL skills for data manipulation/analysis   Expert using data governance technologies such as Collibra or Informatica Axon and EDC   Strong background and working knowledge of end-to-end data management principles   Strong background in developing and utilizing tools that prepare, extract and manipulate data to create Connected datasets (data warehousing) that can be utilized for analytics purposes.   Strong background and working knowledge of data quality improvements and/or master data management   Experience discussing complex and new topics in a simple, easy-to-understand manner   Demonstrated teamwork   Working knowledge of Data Lakes, and the Hadoop ecosystem   Strong, demonstrated written and presentation skills  Primary Location: Texas - WoodlandsJob Function: ProfessionalFLSA Status: ProfessionalRelocation Option: Level IIUnion description/code: NON BARGAINING UNIT-NBUNumber of Openings: 1Req ID: 101691Travel Percentage: Up to 25%An Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disability/Vets. Please click here to view the full statement.Working ConditionsAs a provider of essential services, Entergy expects its employees to be available to work additional hours, to work in alternate locations, and/or to perform additional duties in connection with storms, outages, emergencies, or other situations as deemed necessary by the company. Exempt employees may not be paid overtime associated with such duties.', ' Desired : M.S. in economics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, finance, engineering or other analytical field ']

job_title: Sr. Sales Operations & Reporting Analyst (Power BI)
job_text: ['', 'Help drive initiatives to further expand the scope of the current sales reporting environment', 'Effectively analyze and communicate relevant information and insights to senior management', 'AspenTech is currently looking for a dynamic and energetic individual as a Sr. Sales Operations and Reporting Analyst focusing on data analysis and reporting for the Business Analytics group within Global Sales Operations. The primary role of the Analyst is to be a driving force within the Business Analytics team to enable optimized performance in the sales teams. This individual will be expected to provide insight and business recommendations based on analysis involving data, systems, and performance. They will play a key role in forecasting, identify opportunities for improvement with sales operations processes, partner on the development of reporting tools to support sales objectives, deliver analysis, track sales performance, and lead special projects. This position is located in Bedford, MA.', '2+ Experience with Business Intelligence tool, Tableau Prep or PowerBI preferred', 'Deliver periodic reporting and analysis on Sales KPIs for Management reporting', 'Experience with a CRM system, specifically Salesforce.com preferred', 'Develop timely, accurate, and insightful reports and analysis to field sales and sales management related to sales performance.', 'Motivated, self-starter, with a solid work ethic, ability to manage change, and a "can-do" attitude a must', 'What You’ll Need:', 'Perform complex ad hoc analysis as required in support of Sales Organization', 'Ability to gain understanding of customers and customer issues to propose effective analytic solutions', 'Bachelor\'s Degree required4+ years of data-driven analytics, within the sales, sales strategy, finance or marketing preferred2+ Experience with Business Intelligence tool, Tableau Prep or PowerBI preferredHigh level of comfort with Microsoft Office: Excel and PowerPoint.Experience with a CRM system, specifically Salesforce.com preferredMotivated, self-starter, with a solid work ethic, ability to manage change, and a "can-do" attitude a mustDemonstrated ability to deliver results and adapt to changing business requirements; ability to plan, organize and manage multiple prioritiesExcellent attention to detail and organizational skillsStrong written and oral communication skills are imperative.', 'High level of comfort with Microsoft Office: Excel and PowerPoint.', 'AspenTech is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran Status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.', '\xa0', 'Your Impact:', 'The Role:', '4+ years of data-driven analytics, within the sales, sales strategy, finance or marketing preferred', 'Work with sales stakeholders to identify and measure key performance indicators for the sales organization', 'Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills', 'Partner with other business stakeholders on refining best practices to manage and maintain CRM data', 'Strong written and oral communication skills are imperative.', 'Develop timely, accurate, and insightful reports and analysis to field sales and sales management related to sales performance.Work with sales stakeholders to identify and measure key performance indicators for the sales organizationEffectively analyze and communicate relevant information and insights to senior managementDeliver periodic reporting and analysis on Sales KPIs for Management reportingPartner with other business stakeholders on refining best practices to manage and maintain CRM dataAbility to gain understanding of customers and customer issues to propose effective analytic solutionsPerform complex ad hoc analysis as required in support of Sales OrganizationHelp drive initiatives to further expand the scope of the current sales reporting environment', 'Demonstrated ability to deliver results and adapt to changing business requirements; ability to plan, organize and manage multiple priorities', "Bachelor's Degree required"]

assist in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems.', 'Candidates for positions with the Recreation and Park Department may be disqualified from consideration should their conviction history not meet the standards established under California Public Resources Code 5164. ', 'Minimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire: (Weight: Qualifying)', 'AND', 'SUBSTITUTION', 'GENERAL INFORMATION CONCERNING CITY AND COUNTY OF SAN FRANCISCO EMPLOYMENT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES:', 'Special Conditions', 'Experience successfully managing projects.', 'Experience writing diagnostic (Select) queries in Microsoft SQL or other structured query languages.', 'Veteran’s Preference', 'Experience with creating business and system flow diagrams.', 'Selection Procedures', 'Experience working in a public sector, non-profit agency or organization.', 'Select either “I am a New User” if you have not previously registered, or “I have Registered', ' The HSA of the ', 'Quality Assurance testing experience.', 'Analyze data processing needs; research and evaluate software on multiple platforms to assist users to meet their departmental goals; assist in developing the evaluation criteria for software.', 'Copies Of Application Documents', 'This is a Position-Based Test conducted in accordance with Civil Service Rule 111A.', 'Benefits', 'Position Description', 'Seniority Credit In Promotional Exams', 'One (1) year of recent and verifiable experience in information system business process design.', 'Supplemental Questionnaire: (Weight: 100%)', 'Driver’s License Requirement', 'Verification Of Experience And/Or Education', 'Previously”', 'Reasonable Accommodation Request', 'May provide technical production support for application systems; assist with processing schedule, assist with creating reports.', 'Working knowledge of Balsamiq mockup tool.', "Applicants must meet the Minimum Qualification requirements by the final filing date unless otherwise noted. **Verification Of Experience And/Or EducationApplicants may be required to submit verification of qualifying education and experience at any point during the recruitment and selection process. Refer to the following links for verification: https://sfdhr.org/information-about-hiring-processEducation Verification, including verifying foreign credits or degree equivalency: https://sfdhr.org/how-verify-education-requirements%20Note: Falsifying one’s education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco.How To ApplyApplications for City and County of San Francisco jobs are only accepted through an online process.Visit www.jobaps.com/sf to register an account (if you have not already done so) and begin the application process. Select the desired job announcement (PBT-1052-108424) Select “Apply” and read and acknowledge the information Select either “I am a New User” if you have not previously registered, or “I have Registered Previously” Follow instructions on the screen In line with the Official Public Health Order to slow the spread of COVID-19, a “shelter-in-place” has been issued for all San Francisco residents and this order is expected to be in effect until further notice. As a result, the Department of Human Resources (DHR)’s office (located at 1 South Van Ness Avenue, 4th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94103) is currently closed to the general public. If you have any questions, please feel free to email the Human Resources Analyst listed on this announcement.Click here to view a video tutorial on how to apply for City jobs.Applicants may be contacted by email about this announcement and, therefore, it is their responsibility to ensure that their registered email address is accurate and kept up-to-date. Also, applicants must ensure that email from CCSF is not blocked on their computer by a spam filter. To prevent blocking, applicants should set up their email to accept CCSF mail from the following addresses (@sfgov.org, @sfdpw.org, @sfport.com, @flysfo.com, @sfwater.org, @sfdph.org, @asianart.org, @sfmta.com, @sfpl.org, @dcyf.org, @first5sf.org).Applicants will receive a confirmation email that their online application has been received in response to every announcement for which they file. Applicants should retain this confirmation email for their records. Failure to receive this email means that the online application was not submitted or received.All work experience, education, training, and other information substantiating how you meet the minimum qualifications must be included in your application by the filing deadline. Information submitted after the filing deadline will not be considered in determining whether you meet the minimum qualifications. Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, disqualification, or may lead to lower scores.If you have any questions regarding this recruitment or application process, please contact the exam analyst, Tamara Ranney, by telephone at 415.770.4126, or by email at tamara.ranney@sfgov.org .Selection PlanMinimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire: (Weight: Qualifying)Supplemental Questionnaire: (Weight: 100%)Selection Procedures MINIMUM QUALIFICATION SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONNAIRE: (Weight: Qualifying) Candidates will be prompted to complete a Supplemental Questionnaire as part of the online employment application. This Minimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire is designed to obtain specific information regarding an applicant's experience in relation to the Minimum Qualifications for this position. Applicants must also complete the official application. It is essential that applicants provide complete information in identifying their education, experience, and training. The Minimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire will be used to evaluate if the applicant possesses the required minimum qualifications.SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONNAIRE: (Weight: 100%)Candidates will be prompted to complete a supplemental questionnaire as part of the online employment application. The Supplemental Questionnaire is designed to measure an applicant’s relative knowledge, skills, and abilities in job-related areas identified as critical for successful performance. These may include but are not limited to knowledge of web and mobile applications and its development; knowledge of installation procedures, requirements, software and maintenance of systems; knowledge of system analysis and design; knowledge and ability to analyze data and information; ability to use logic and analysis to solve computer and systems problems; ability to translate functional requirements into technical specifications; interpersonal skills; oral and written communication skills.All responses to the Supplemental Questionnaire are subject to verification and should be consistent with the information provided in your application.NOTE: Passing score must be achieved on the supplemental questionnaire in order to continue in the selection process.CERTIFICATIONThe certification rule for the eligible list resulting from this examination process will be Rule of Ten (10) Scores. The hiring department may conduct additional selection processes to make final hiring decisions.Eligible List/Score ReportA confidential eligible list of applicant names that have passed the civil service examination process will be created and used for certification purposes only. An examination score report will be established, so applicants can view the ranks, final scores, and the number of eligible candidates. Applicant information, including names of applicants on the eligible list, shall not be made public unless required by law. However, an eligible list shall be made available for public inspection, upon request, once the eligible list is exhausted or expired and referrals resolved. The eligible list/score report resulting from this civil service examination process is subject to change after adoption (e.g., as a result of appeals), as directed by the Human Resources Director or the Civil Service CommissionThe duration of the eligible list resulting from this examination process will be six (6) months and may be extended with the approval of the Human Resources Director.Upon approval of the Human Resource Director (see Civil Service Rule 111A.26.5), the eligible list/score report resulting from this announcement may be used by other departments that also use this classification or a similar classification. To find other Departments that use this classification, please see https://sfdhr.org/sites/default/files/documents/ASO-Level-Chart.pdf?documentID=21246 .Conviction HistoryIf a Conflict Exists, You Will Be Asked To Present Any Evidence Of Rehabilitation That May Mitigate The Conflict, Except When Federal Or State Regulations Bar Employment In Specific Circumstances, Such AsAs a selected candidate for a job, you will be fingerprinted, and your fingerprints will be sent to the California Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). The resulting report of your conviction history (if any) will be used to determine whether the nature of your conviction (or arrest, in limited circumstances) conflicts with the specific duties and responsibilities of the job for which you are a selected candidate. Candidates for positions with the Unified School District and the Community College District may be disqualified from consideration should their conviction history not meet the standards established under the California Education Code.  Candidates for positions with the Recreation and Park Department may be disqualified from consideration should their conviction history not meet the standards established under California Public Resources Code 5164.  Having a conviction history does not automatically preclude you from a job with the City.If you are a selected candidate, the hiring department will contact you to schedule a fingerprinting appointment.Disaster Service WorkersAll City and County of San Francisco employees are designated Disaster Service Workers through state and local law (California Government Code Section 3100-3109). Employment with the City requires the affirmation of a loyalty oath to this effect. Employees are required to complete all Disaster Service Worker-related training as assigned, and to return to work as ordered in the event of an emergency.ConclusionTerms Of AnnouncementApplicants must be guided solely by the provisions of this announcement, including requirements, time periods, and other particulars, except when superseded by federal, state, or local laws, rules, or regulations. Clerical errors may be corrected by posting the correction on the Department of Human Resources website at www.jobapscloud.com/sf/ . The terms of this announcement may be appealed under Civil Service Rule 111A.35.1. The standard for the review of such appeals is ‘abuse of discretion’ or ‘no rational basis’ for establishing the position description, the minimum qualifications and/or the certification rule. Appeals must include a written statement of the item(s) being contested and the specific reason(s) why the cited item(s) constitute(s) abuse of discretion by the Human Resources Director. Appeals must be submitted directly to the Executive Officer of the Civil Service Commission within five business days of the announcement issuance date.Note On Personal Protective Equipment (ppe)Some positions in the Human Services Agency will require the use of personal protective equipment (PPE), including but not limited to gloves, gowns, eye and face protection, and face-fitting respirators. The requirement for the use of PPE may come on short or no notice. Facial hair or any condition that interferes with a face-fitting respirator’s seal (i.e. comes between the sealing surfaces of the respirator and the wearer’s bare skin) is not permitted when face-fitting respirators are worn, including during initial or periodic respirator fit-testing. Employees who choose not to shave and do not have either American Disabilities Act (ADA) or Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Accommodations do not have the right to alternate work assignments or the option of using a loose-fitting Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR) in place of a face-fitting respirator.GENERAL INFORMATION CONCERNING CITY AND COUNTY OF SAN FRANCISCO EMPLOYMENT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES:Important Employment Information for the City and County of San Francisco can be obtained at http://sfdhr.org/information-about-hiring-process or hard copy at 1 South Van Ness Avenue, 4th Floor.Copies Of Application DocumentsApplicants should keep copies of all documents submitted, as these will not be returned.Reasonable Accommodation RequestInformation on requesting a reasonable accommodation for persons with disabilities can be found at: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#reasonableaccommodationSeniority Credit In Promotional ExamsInformation regarding seniority credit can be found at: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#senioritycreditDriver’s License RequirementMost positions require a valid California’s driver’s license: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#licenseVeteran’s Preferencehttp://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#veteranspreferenceClerical ErrorsMay be corrected by the posting of the correction on the Department of Human Resources website at: http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#announcementsdefinitionsRight To WorkAll persons entering the City and County of San Francisco workforce are required to provide verification of authorization to work in the United States. http://www.sfdhr.org/index.aspx?page=20#identification The HSA of the  City and County of San Francisco shares a commitment to a diverse, inclusive, and equitable community. Each member of our organization is responsible and accountable for promoting success, being compassionate, and ensuring that everyone has a voice to make San Francisco an inclusive and equitable place to live and work by employing fair and just practices to and for all.Exam Type: CPE (Combine and Promotive Examination)Issued: March 8, 2021Carol Isen, Acting Human Resources DirectorDepartment of Human ResourcesRecruitment ID Number: PBT-1052-108424HSA/ TR / 415-770-4126BenefitsAll employees hired on or after January 10, 2009 will be required (pursuant to San Francisco Charter Section A8.432) to contribute 2% of pre-tax compensation to fund retiree healthcare. In addition, most employees are required to make a member contribution towards retirement, ranging from 7.5%-13.25% of compensation. For more information on these provisions, please contact the personnel office of the hiring agency.", 'Conviction History', 'One (1) year in the information systems field, including technical support, content management, administration of network applications or system analysis.', 'Provide technical support for web application and mobile application systems; consult on the analysis of an application; troubleshoot system problems; assist with the implementation of solutions.']

job_title: Healthcare Data Analyst II - Finance Analytics (Remote Options)
job_text: ['', ' Serve as technical lead in analysis and reporting efforts that support the department in healthcare data analyses, including but not limited to, financial forecasting, costs and utilization reporting, and data modeling for healthcare data. Exercises timely and accurate data mining techniques and develops new or modifies existing reports that ensure consistent conclusions to data analysis. Design and enhance databases to support reporting and analysis needs, including testing, validating, and maintaining data integrity and accuracy, across multiple databases. Use analytical skills to determine solutions and resolve problems. Responsible for evaluating report requests to determine requestor’s needs and objectives, identifying correct methodology for extracting data including data sources and criteria, and ensuring the delivered report is accurate, timely, and formatted appropriately. Significant participation in analysis, interpretation, and translating of complex health plan data, issues, trends, and relationships into effective strategies and action plans. Responsible for managing assigned projects and effectively communicating with the leadership team any project deadlines that may be in jeopardy of being met, well in advance of the due date. Present findings of analyses to various staff levels including executive team, leadership team and staff levels. Present results in formats that are easy to understand and appropriate to the audience. Document all analysis / reporting projects following established protocols, ensuring replication of results by an independent reviewer. Demonstrate a commitment to incorporate LEAN principles into daily work. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with others throughout the organization. Perform special projects and other duties as assigned by the department leadership team.', ' Design and enhance databases to support reporting and analysis needs, including testing, validating, and maintaining data integrity and accuracy, across multiple databases.', 'Working Conditions', ' Present findings of analyses to various staff levels including executive team, leadership team and staff levels. ', 'Develop electronic lab information management process for sample scheduling, logging, and testing.', 'Supports the implementation of the Quality Management System (QMS) processes.', ' Supports other Departments in DiscGenics to enable quality by design. Conduct training on quality system processes, GMP and GDP. Inspect product or review batch records as needed. Work to establish a training program and trainer qualification program. Develop environmental monitoring program for pilot scale and process development laboratories.  Create quality SOPs and templates and assist other functional areas in creating department specific SOPs and templates. Provide guidance on microbiology laboratory, cleanroom, and utility design plans. Support validation of clean rooms and utilities (HVAC, compressed air, water system, etc) and cleanroom cleaning processes.  Provide subject matter expertise on contamination control/risk mitigation. Support the procurement, qualification, and maintenance of laboratory equipment including cleaning, preventative maintenance, calibration, and qualification/re-qualification activities. Validate microbiology laboratory test methods. Conduct investigations regarding out of specification (OOS) results and facilitates implementation of meaningful corrective and preventative actions for microbiological related issues. Prepare and analyze periodic summary reports of quality control test results, environmental monitoring data, microbial profiles of environmental areas, and aseptic behavior. Identifies and elevates adverse trends to CAPA process and management review.  Support terminal sterilization validation efforts for steam sterilizers. Provide oversight of contract lab facilities which includes performing site audits as the SME, and reviewing quotes and technical reports.  Participate in regulatory audits as the microbiology/environmental monitoring SME. Develop electronic lab information management process for sample scheduling, logging, and testing. job_title: Business Systems & Process Analyst - Data Quality
job_text: ['', ' Performs in-depth analysis of workers compensation insurance data to identify quality concerns, usage concerns, gaps in validation tests, edits, or operational procedures.  Develops and implements new data quality processes and enhanced data quality tests. ', ' Able to takes on lead role for new and complex assignments with unfamiliar subject-matter quickly and with minimal ramp-up and direction as to approach to gathering key information to research; resourceful. ', ' Able to envision and document new systems functionality and processes/ procedures considering customer service impacts; delivering associated team training. ', ' ', ' A competitive starting base salary plus a targeted annual performance bonus ', ' Experienced using data extract and systems testing tools; can recommend tools for particular uses to meet team needs. ', ' Participates in decisions on data reporting rules or system changes that impact data quality or data usage. ', 'WHAT YOU MUST BRING TO THE ROLE: ', ' Experience developing and maintaining strong industry relationships including with customers, data collection organizations, and industry groups as required by particular role.   Expert user of MS Excel, Access or similar spreadsheet/data applications.   Experienced using data extract and systems testing tools; can recommend tools for particular uses to meet team needs.  ', "WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:", ' Experience developing data standards, data layouts, database uses, data viewing tools, and data reports in products and work processes; understands impacts of change across data management areas. ', ' A phenomenal work environment, with perks including onsite restaurant and coffee shop, employee activities, onsite fitness center, and sports leagues ', 'WHAT WILL MAKE YOU A MORE VIABLE CANDIDATE: ', ' Experience partnering on the creation of business requirements for projects not led by, but impacting function - reviewing and providing feedback on requirements as needed. ', ' Experience developing mission-critical queries from which important directional decisions are made; comfortable writing new code and working with existing query code making modifications to meet needs. ', 'WHAT YOU WILL DO IN THIS JOB: ', ' Experience developing plans to meet broad customer communication needs, developing communication content, and leading review; providing input on external customer communications and manuals. ', ' Experience evaluating data quality issues and their materiality on uses such as ratemaking, experience rating, actuarial research. ', ' A wonderful team of dynamic people to work with who are fun, caring and friendly ', ' A fantastic benefits package that is hard to find in South Florida ', ' Experience programming to support data quality research and development work. ', 'WHO WE ARE', ' Provides support to business partners on data quality, data quality systems, and data usage issues, including assistance in prioritization. ', ' Experience developing and maintaining strong industry relationships including with customers, data collection organizations, and industry groups as required by particular role. ', ' A competitive starting base salary plus a targeted annual performance bonus   A phenomenal work environment, with perks including onsite restaurant and coffee shop, employee activities, onsite fitness center, and sports leagues   A wonderful team of dynamic people to work with who are fun, caring and friendly   A fantastic benefits package that is hard to find in South Florida  ', ' Understanding of testing strategies, types of systems testing, and test plans. ', ' Acts as Business Lead on technical processes including:\xa0 Investment, Discretionary, and Baseline system activities - includes establishing workflow, project vision and scope, project approach, preparing project packages for approval, writing requirements, reviewing design, performing testing, and coordinating with other NCCI projects. Develops and implements new data quality processes and enhanced data quality tests.   Acts as Business Lead on technical processes including:\xa0 Investment, Discretionary, and Baseline system activities - includes establishing workflow, project vision and scope, project approach, preparing project packages for approval, writing requirements, reviewing design, performing testing, and coordinating with other NCCI projects. ['', 'Launch and actively optimize campaigns across trading platforms', 'required\xa0', 'transparent', 'Optimization and Innovation Senior Analyst', "We're\xa0fun. You'll work with and learn from the smartest people in the industry and have a blast doing it.\xa0", 'Kepler executes engineered marketing, where every message and ad delivered helps create a more personalized and productive relationship between brands and their consumers. We do this by acting as clients’ agency of record, as their in-house team, or some hybrid of the two – and by harnessing data and technology across all paid digital media and data-driven CRM channels.']

['Business Team Member (Project Roles)', ' Analytical role in projects; utilization of ACBS system functionality, upgrades, bank initiatives, outsourcing initiatives, regulatory changes, and line of business expansions are the key areas of emphasis.  Analytical in areas of ACBS functionality and its surrounding applications.  Serves as team member for Participation Operations projects, as needed.  Represents the business needs of the department, finance division, lending, outsourcing customers or other partners on projects.  Analyzes other applications and systems related to project initiative.  Adheres to project methodology according to established standards, handles change control, processes recovery procedures, and conducts knowledge transfer to others.  Involved in association related participation, system changes and upgrades.  Prepares or reviews procedures for assigned manuals resulting from project changes.', 'Ensure accuracy of ACBS information keyed by Loan Servicing.', 'Maintain efficient accounting and control on complex portfolio of large participated loans from a diverse group of originators. ', 'Performs complex transactions to include advances, payments, fixed rate conversions and rollovers for various pricing options on the ACBS system. job_text: ['', 'Top 3-5 Requirements:', 'BA or BS degree required', 'Own Business Requirement Document (BRD) and Functional Specifications Requirements (FSR).', 'Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and strong oral and written communications skills', 'Business analysis', 'Experience working with large and complex data set; able to write SQL queries to create calculated fields or perform feasibility analysis as part of functional specification requirement documentation.', 'Responsible for determining how changing business needs will affect the solutioning approach.', 'Pharma/Commercial', 'Experience in the commercial space (sales operations, commercial operations, marketing, market access) within bio-pharma industry.', 'Exhibit obsession with details (in both backend data and frontend user interface) and live in the mantra “The devils are in the details”.', 'Collaborate with data teams and QA analysts during requirements, build, testing phase.', 'The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for an experienced Business/Data Analyst who would be interested in a remote contract opportunity offered within the Lake County, IL region.', 'Job Responsibilities:', 'Solid understanding of data systems (BI/Analytics, Data Blending, Data Warehousing, Data ETL, etc.) on process automation and standardization and be able to speak the language with ease.', 'Serve as a liaison between BTS, business stakeholders and end users.', 'Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs.Document requirements define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.Own Business Requirement Document (BRD) and Functional Specifications Requirements (FSR).Serve as a liaison between BTS, business stakeholders and end users.Perform requirements analysis.Consults with functional areas to develop understanding of the varied and complex business needs supported.Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and timeline; monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actionsResponsible for determining how changing business needs will affect the solutioning approach.Collaborate with data teams and QA analysts during requirements, build, testing phase.Have the confidence to work cross-functionally with various departments including business stakeholders and technical personnel to exchange ideas.In the events of fluid business objective, proactively identify risks and mitigation recommendations to keep projects on track.Must have excellent verbal communications skills and documentation skills to maintain workflows and dashboard functionality.Exhibit obsession with details (in both backend data and frontend user interface) and live in the mantra “The devils are in the details”.', 'Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and timeline; monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions', 'Must have excellent verbal communications skills and documentation skills to maintain workflows and dashboard functionality.', 'Job Details:\xa0', 'Required Experience in the commercial space (sales operations, commercial operations, marketing, market access) within bio-pharma industry.', 'Preferred: Master’s degree in data related fields (Analytics, Business Intelligence, Big Data, Statistics) preferred.', 'Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs.', 'SQL', 'Business System Analyst is a key member of the Data & Analytics team which is part of Business Technology Solutions (BTS) organization, and will manage the life cycle of analytics projects, including business requirements gathering, functional specification write-up, prototyping, development, quality testing, user acceptance testing, roll-out, and post-launch enhancements implementation. Candidate will work closely with various business functions including Commercial Operations, Sales Operations, Field Sales and Marketing to understand business needs on reporting, provide visualization recommendations, and deliver analytics solutions.', 'Minimum 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.', 'Document requirements define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.', 'The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.', 'Have the confidence to work cross-functionally with various departments including business stakeholders and technical personnel to exchange ideas.', 'Strong time management and prioritization skills; able to manage multiple projects simultaneously at various stages of their development.', 'Perform requirements analysis.', 'In the events of fluid business objective, proactively identify risks and mitigation recommendations to keep projects on track.', 'Consults with functional areas to develop understanding of the varied and complex business needs supported.', 'Added Requirements:', 'Required Experience in the commercial space (sales operations, commercial operations, marketing, market access) within bio-pharma industry.Business analysisSQLPharma/CommercialExcellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and strong oral and written communications skills', 'BA or BS degree requiredMinimum 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.Experience in the commercial space (sales operations, commercial operations, marketing, market access) within bio-pharma industry.Solid understanding of data systems (BI/Analytics, Data Blending, Data Warehousing, Data ETL, etc.) on process automation and standardization and be able to speak the language with ease.Experience working with large and complex data set; able to write SQL queries to create calculated fields or perform feasibility analysis as part of functional specification requirement documentation.The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.Strong time management and prioritization skills; able to manage multiple projects simultaneously at various stages of their development.Preferred: Master’s degree in data related fields (Analytics, Business Intelligence, Big Data, Statistics) preferred.']

Utilizing Database mechanisms, Microsoft Access & Visual Basic to develop and improve reporting processes. Maintaining detailed records documenting procedures and assumptions, methodologies and sources of information employed during the performance of all analytical tasks. ['', '■\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Excellent written and verbal communication skills; must be able to communicate clearly, comfortably, and professionally with internal and external clients including senior leaders', 'Lead workstreams as we are digitizing compensation processes across the Firm', 'Qualifications', 'Assist in the annual year-end compensation decision-making process for some populations in the Firm', 'Analyze colleague information to benchmark relative compensation across peer groups and create reports to identify trends and outliers', 'Utilizing analytics to support the design of compensation models for paths, including the assessment of cost implications, incorporation of stakeholder feedback, and the development of implementation plans\xa0Collaborate with MCLs and HR and talent management colleagues to review compensation structures or support the implementation of new compensation modelsAnalyze colleague information to benchmark relative compensation across peer groups and create reports to identify trends and outliersLead workstreams as we are digitizing compensation processes across the FirmSupport the Global Compensation Function’s annual process of setting and communicating compensation caps and structures for senior Firm membersAssist in the annual year-end compensation decision-making process for some populations in the Firm', '■\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Stellar analytic and problem-solving skills; organizational skills and attention to detail, coupled with the ability to see big-picture trends; ability to thrive under pressure and multi-task; high level of maturity.\xa0Entrepreneurial and self-directed', 'Our client is a global management consulting firm that helps leading corporations and organizations make distinctive, lasting, and substantial improvements in their performance. Over more than nine decades, the\xa0Firm’s\xa0primary objective has remained constant: to serve senior leaders as their most trusted external\xa0advisor\xa0on critical issues facing their organizations.', 'Collaborate with MCLs and HR and talent management colleagues to review compensation structures or support the implementation of new compensation models', '\xa0', '\xa0Whom You’ll Work With', 'Support the Global Compensation Function’s annual process of setting and communicating compensation caps and structures for senior Firm members', 'You will be part of the Global Compensation Function (GCF) focused on designing global compensation structures and conducting an analytic assessment on compensation for our pre-partner consultants.\xa0The Global Compensation Function (GCF) was established in 2017 with the overarching aspiration to create a “One Firm” approach to compensation that provides principle-based guidance and design of compensation grids across paths and markets.\xa0We oversee compensation design, guidance, and the execution of compensation for our most senior-level roles.\xa0', 'You will collaborate with colleagues inside the GCF and a wide variety of Firm stakeholders, provide analytical support on compensation-related projects, driving complex analyses, and deriving insights that lead to a larger harmonization of the Firm’s approach to pre-partner compensation. Specific activities on a wide range of topics are likely to include:', '■\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0University degree (concentration in HR, business, or math-related area is preferred)', 'Utilizing analytics to support the design of compensation models for paths, including the assessment of cost implications, incorporation of stakeholder feedback, and the development of implementation plans\xa0', 'What You’ll Do', '■\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Minimum 3 years relevant experience, including experience as a Compensation Analyst or HR/People Analyst and/or experience in Firm People and/or Practice related roles', 'Within the GCF, you will be part of the team that drives initiatives in the compensation space—specifically focused on conducting analytics and designing compensation structures across pre-partner paths. The team leads the global effort to harmonize compensation across various pre-partner paths, including designing compensation models and working with Market Compensation Leads (MCLs) to drive implementation.', '■\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Expert Excel (with knowledge of advanced Excel formulas), PowerPoint, and Word user; knowledge of Firm systems a plus.\xa0Experience with HRIS systems and/or exposure to R or Python helpful but not required.\xa0']

['', "And here's what's in it for you:", 'Meaningful impact: Homes are core to all of us - they’re not just a big financial responsibility; homes are a place of safety and shelter, as well as a place where renters can hope to launch their hopes and dreams. Finding a home is a daunting, emotional process, and your work will make a real difference in renters’ lives.', "Here are the skills and experience you'll need to be successful:", '2-5 years of experience in product management working on data products or as a Product Analyst or Data Engineer with some Product Management experience.', 'We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed, we encourage you to apply.', 'Work with data engineering and analytics teams to deliver a best in class data infrastructure that yields timely, accurate and actionable insights for all internal and external consumers.', 'Self-starter: you and the head of analytics will own the strategy and will define what your own success is.', 'Massive impact and visibility: You’ll have a ton of visibility at all levels of the company. You will be helping everyone from the sales people making better use of data during their pitch to the CEO being more impactful with the right use of data.', "Here's what you'll do as the Product Manager for Data:", 'Build the roadmap to make data our competitive advantage, identifying where our customers can make better decisions and providing them actionable insights along the way.Work with data engineering and analytics teams to deliver a best in class data infrastructure that yields timely, accurate and actionable insights for all internal and external consumers.Build processes and policies with organization-wide support that ensures the long term success of your data strategy.Evangelize what the future of our data-driven organization looks like to the entire company and build excitement behind your vision.Partner with product teams to collect data in a clean and actionable manner, helping them define how to best structure their dashboards and reporting needs.', 'Career development: We’re always growing, and will expect your scope & responsibilities to grow alongside your impact.', 'Evangelize what the future of our data-driven organization looks like to the entire company and build excitement behind your vision.', 'Build processes and policies with organization-wide support that ensures the long term success of your data strategy.', 'Excellence is important to you - you want to be amongst kind, passionate people who push each other to be better.', 'You believe that the best work comes from a team that’s unified in their mission - you prioritize getting everyone on the same page, and take pride that your teammates all feel the ownership and hunger to create the best experience for our users.', 'Track record of building excitement about internal infrastructure projects and launching on time.', 'Reporting into the Senior Director of Product for Supply and Systems, you will be responsible for making sure our data is accurate, timely and accessible to internal employees, and eventually to property managers and renters. You will work closely with a wide range of stakeholders, understanding the business needs and making insights available to meet those needs. You will also be the evangelist for a stronger data-driven organization.', '2-5 years of experience in product management working on data products or as a Product Analyst or Data Engineer with some Product Management experience.Self-starter: you and the head of analytics will own the strategy and will define what your own success is.Knowledge of data pipeline design and previous experience developing or upgrading an internal Data infrastructure.Track record of building excitement about internal infrastructure projects and launching on time.Analytically and technically fluent - you can spend hours discussing architecture trade-offs with senior engineers while understanding the analytics implications.', "You believe that the best work comes from a team that’s unified in their mission - you prioritize getting everyone on the same page, and take pride that your teammates all feel the ownership and hunger to create the best experience for our users.Being user-centric as the first principle: whether it’s property managers, leasing agents, renters or fellow apartment listers, you can articulate the pain points of data's customers - you thrive on crafting insights from qualitative and quantitative research, and then brainstorming solutions with the team.Excellence is important to you - you want to be amongst kind, passionate people who push each other to be better.", 'Analytically and technically fluent - you can spend hours discussing architecture trade-offs with senior engineers while understanding the analytics implications.', 'Knowledge of data pipeline design and previous experience developing or upgrading an internal Data infrastructure.', 'We’re on a mission to help everyone find a home they love while making the search simple and painless. Together, we can change the narrative around what it means to be a renter. And while we have grown very quickly over the past few years, your job will be to take our data infrastructure and processes to the next level, making data an internal strategic advantage.', 'What you believe in / stand for:', 'An exceptional team: our hiring bar is high and your colleagues are talented, motivated, self-starters.', 'Partner with product teams to collect data in a clean and actionable manner, helping them define how to best structure their dashboards and reporting needs.', "Being user-centric as the first principle: whether it’s property managers, leasing agents, renters or fellow apartment listers, you can articulate the pain points of data's customers - you thrive on crafting insights from qualitative and quantitative research, and then brainstorming solutions with the team.", 'Apartment List is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.', 'Massive impact and visibility: You’ll have a ton of visibility at all levels of the company. You will be helping everyone from the sales people making better use of data during their pitch to the CEO being more impactful with the right use of data.Career development: We’re always growing, and will expect your scope & responsibilities to grow alongside your impact.An exceptional team: our hiring bar is high and your colleagues are talented, motivated, self-starters.Meaningful impact: Homes are core to all of us - they’re not just a big financial responsibility; homes are a place of safety and shelter, as well as a place where renters can hope to launch their hopes and dreams. Finding a home is a daunting, emotional process, and your work will make a real difference in renters’ lives.', 'Build the roadmap to make data our competitive advantage, identifying where our customers can make better decisions and providing them actionable insights along the way.']

['', '~ Excellent verbal and written communication skills.', '~ Strong design aesthetic and visualization skills.', '~ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.', 'Responsibilities:', 'NOTE', '~ Expert user in Microsoft Office, Excel, and HR systems (HRIS, ATS, etc.)', '~ Prepares reports of data results, presenting and explaining findings to senior departmental leadership.', '~ Generates reports/queries, including writing, maintaining, and supporting a variety of reports or queries utilizing appropriate reporting tools. Assists in development of standard reports for ongoing customer needs. Helps maintain data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data.', 'Required:', 'You will be in a position where you will be working on new processes, and at times, developing and implementing them from the start. Because we are building the bus while we drive it, there will be moments you will be left with little instruction and you will be expected to find answers and develop proposed roadmaps for the best way forward. ', '~ Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS) and payroll outputs, management and employee surveys, exit interviews, employment records, government labor statistics, competitors practices, and other sources.', '~ May conduct or assist with conducting classification audits as directed.', '~ Experience in startups is preferred, or experience mix of both smaller and larger companies required.', '~ Trains new HR system users and manages internal HRIS SOPs for departmental use.', '~ Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.', '~ May assist HR leadership with staffing and departmental budgets.', '~ Based on metrics and analysis, makes recommendations for policies and activities to improve the organizational culture including suggestions to attract and hire qualified candidates, to motivate and retain employees, to address staffing issues, and to maintain legal compliance.', '~ Experience building and refining processes, as the company grows.', 'Under the general discretion of the HR Director, the Senior HR Business Analyst will bring a strong analytical background and will dive into reporting, forecasting, and planning with enthusiasm! They will be requested to both pull data and manage data - understanding the bigger picture and corporate strategy is a must. They will work from a business perspective to do the planning and financial impact reports by department. This position requires expert skills in Excel, Business analytics, and overall experience in a variety of HRIS systems. While there are no formal direct reports in this role, it requires pro-active engagement in decision making, self-directed approach to work and the ability to drive delivery.\xa0While this role will not manage people, they will be accountable for managing high-profile, highly complex, long-term projects delivered to our most senior leaders.', '~ Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, or analytical field required.', '~ Project Management Professional (PMP®) credential desired.', '~ Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to compensation, recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance with employment laws and regulations.', '~ Will assist with performance, benefit, and compensation review and evaluation processes.', 'NOTE: This opportunity is located in Santa Barbara County', '~ At least three years of experience in related areas such as job classification and compensation, recruitment, selection, training, employee benefits, and/or equal opportunity compliance preferred.', '~ Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn the organizations HRIS, payroll, and similar employee management software.', '~ Ability to work well in a high performing team environment.\xa0Able to work independently in a virtual environment.', '~ Thorough understanding of local, state, and federal laws involving employment, HR, and HR policies (desired).', 'About the Role:', '~ Strong experience with developing actionable management dashboards for HR or Talent organizations.', '~ HRCI (PHR/SPHR) or SHRM Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP) credential preferred.']

Reasonableaccommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Physical DemandsWhile performing the essential functions of this job, the employee is occasionally required tostand; walk; sit; lift; carry; use hands to handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach withhands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop; kneel, crouch or crawl, talk, hear and lift and/ormove up to 40 pounds.Work EnvironmentWhile performing the essential functions of this job, the employee will be exposed to workingconditions commensurate with a traditional office environment.', 'Run, develop and, validate SQL queries to mine data from various systems', 'Work independently on projects and reporting to meet deadlines and requirements', 'Supports the Analyst team in development of new templates for reports for Finance, Operations,and Billing departments', 'Performs modeling for acquisitions and de novos', 'Treats patients and co-workers consistent with the NextCare Mission Statement, Vision, Valuesand Performance Standards.', 'Display strong analytical and problem solving skills while maintaining attention to detail', 'Preparation of daily, weekly, and monthly data and reports for various departments', 'Essential Functions']

['', '• Ability to read, analyze, and interpret financial statements, real estate research reports, government/zoning regulations, and financing structures.', '• Maintain the Firm’s overall portfolio performance return (“Track Record”) updated semi-annually (or quarterly during fundraising) and prepare comparisons against benchmarks for review by the Senior Investment Relations team. Gather and disseminate benchmark data. \xa0', '• An unwavering commitment to integrity (no matter the perceived short-term cost).', '• Comprehensive understanding of the valuation of retail and multifamily assets.\xa0', '• Excellent time management skills with the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.', '• Demonstrated ability to accurately capture large data and find meaningful relationships.', 'Ram is seeking a Portfolio Management Associate to join their Investor Relations team in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida. The Portfolio Reporting Associate will be responsible for portfolio modeling and monitoring of each Fund/vehicle as it relates to (but not limited to) portfolio characteristics including debt levels, geographic weightings, sector exposure, control, sourcing, cash flow, j-curve, and the firm’s performance return. The information will be updated regularly and provided to the Senior Executive team no less than quarterly or with each new investment. They will also assist Investor Relations with accurate performance and portfolio information that can be used for marketing materials and responses to investor requests. \xa0', '• Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited four-year college or university with a major in finance or accounting and three years of relevant work experience or an equivalent combination of experience and education (Graduate degree preferred).', '• Strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently and within a team environment across various functions/departments, paying close attention to the quality of deliverables.', '• Assist in growing, supporting, and mentoring the firm’s Analyst team. Review and oversee the Analysts work as needed.\xa0', '• Humility and an ability to admit “I don’t know” or “I made a mistake”.', '• Assist Investor Relations as needed with any of the following: investor requests, Fund performance requests, DDQs, RFP’s, track record analysis, consultant questionnaires/databases, annual meeting materials and presentations.', '• High degree of professionalism.', '• A strong sense of respect for self and others.', '• Highly organized, methodical, and process oriented.', '• Prepare and distribute quarterly consultant (existing and potential future investor) updates.\xa0', 'These characteristics and skills are essential for success in this role:', 'Qualifications: ', '• Must be a critical thinker and have a comfort level challenging the status quo and/or conventional wisdom.', 'These characteristics are highly valued throughout the Company and essential for all team members:', '• Commitment to quality and a constant desire for improvement.', '• Relevant real estate experience (commercial and multifamily) and a demonstrated ability to perform financial analysis both on an individual asset level as well as portfolio/fund level using methodologies such as NPV analysis and IRR analysis. \xa0This includes property and fund level waterfalls.\xa0', '• Professional experience with financial modeling and analysis, including scenario analyses.', '• Create and maintain a working model of each Fund. The model includes key Fund characteristics and benchmarks as it relates to Fund PPM and IMA. It also has the flexibility to easily add assets to the Fund illustrating the impact of new investments being considered for the Fund versus the actual/current Fund. Examples of Fund characteristics are leverage ratios or tests and weightings of property type, risk, geography, committed vs invested capital, etc.', 'Essential Duties and Responsibilities:\xa0', '• Knowing when and how to ask for help.', '• Demonstrated ability to interpret both property and portfolio level financial results.\xa0', '• Coordinate property level valuation and forecast work (updated 7-year cash flows and property business plans including cash flows and timelines) quarterly with the Asset Management Team. Review thoroughly with an auditor’s critical view. Update and prepare a consolidated roll-up and forecast by Vehicle/Fund. Present to Senior Leaders at quarterly valuation and forecast review meeting. \xa0', '• Strong financial modeling skills and in-depth experience with Excel.\xa0', 'Qualifications: These requirements represent the education, knowledge, skill, certifications/licensure and/or ability required to perform the job satisfactorily. \xa0Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties noted above.', '• Quantitative and analytical experience with a proficiency in Excel a must. Argus strongly preferred.\xa0', '• Prepare and distribute quarterly investor templates.\xa0', '• Adaptability and flexibility.', '• Complete other related projects as needed to support other divisional groups within the firm (i.e. asset management or acquisitions analysis, etc.).\xa0', '• Being open-minded and willing to learn.', '• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.\xa0', 'Please note: \xa0The Team Member Description is not designed to contain a comprehensive list of duties and responsibilities that may be required of the employee. Duties and responsibilities may change at any time with or without notice.', '• Ability to produce, review, analyze, and describe complex financial projections and related schedules.', '• A deep belief in the importance of putting the team first.', '• Assist with market research as requested for the Firm’s specific geographies; dissect trends and collaborate with other teams to qualify data that will help tell the story of an entire market; disseminate market research to the firm on a quarterly basis (and ad hoc, as needed) to be used in Investment Committee Memos, Marketing Materials, etc. \xa0']

job_title: Business Analyst - Salesforce Experience Req'd - Newark, NJ
job_text: ['', 'Knowledge of insurance industry products preferred', 'Manage project risks and issues to resolution.', 'Job Posting', 'Prepare test plans and scenarios for usability testing, execute test scenarios, approve project implementation and verify the production output upon implementation.', '1-3 years of experience working with Salesforce CRM platform ', ' 3-5 years of experience as a business analyst or business consultant 1-3 years of experience working with Salesforce CRM platform  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Ability to effectively communicate and work with all levels of the organization as well as outside consultants and vendors Demonstrated experience completing high impact projects effectively and efficiently Experience analyzing, measuring and evaluating workflows, and processes Ability to make decisions, use independent judgment, establish priorities, and work effectively on multiple initiatives simultaneously in a fast-paced environment Knowledge of insurance industry products preferred Proficient with Microsoft office products with focus on MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Project. ', 'Wintrust Life Finance is looking to hire a Business Analyst with Salesforce experience to join our Business Operations Team in Newark, NJ. This person will be heavily involved in the process of configuration, testing and implementation of Salesforce as well as integration with our current systems. ', 'Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience', '3-5 years of experience as a business analyst or business consultant', ' Plan, lead and execute projects from start to finish ensuring completion and achieving agreed upon objectives. Manage project risks and issues to resolution. Prepare analysis, commentary, and create strong presentations/dashboards, using innovative approaches to show data and findings. Build relationships and work with business partners and stakeholders across the organization. Act as a liaison between the business and IT. Partner with multiple stakeholders at Wintrust to drive root cause analysis and long term mitigation plans, policies and procedures. Prepare test plans and scenarios for usability testing, execute test scenarios, approve project implementation and verify the production output upon implementation. ', 'Ability to make decisions, use independent judgment, establish priorities, and work effectively on multiple initiatives simultaneously in a fast-paced environment', 'Organization', 'Primary Location', 'Proficient with Microsoft office products with focus on MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Project.', 'Plan, lead and execute projects from start to finish ensuring completion and achieving agreed upon objectives.', 'Build relationships and work with business partners and stakeholders across the organization. Act as a liaison between the business and IT.', 'Job', 'Experience analyzing, measuring and evaluating workflows, and processes', 'Prepare analysis, commentary, and create strong presentations/dashboards, using innovative approaches to show data and findings.', 'Demonstrated experience completing high impact projects effectively and efficiently', 'Partner with multiple stakeholders at Wintrust to drive root cause analysis and long term mitigation plans, policies and procedures.', 'Ability to effectively communicate and work with all levels of the organization as well as outside consultants and vendors']

Business Analyst to join our fast-growing team', 'Requirements:', 'Responding to emails and document requests on behalf of executives', 'Calendar management for executives', "Bachelor's degree", 'Today’s global financial system has a significant value transfer problem due to extreme market fragmentation. Over 200 countries, over 200 fiat currencies, tens of thousands of stocks and banks, hundreds of traditional asset exchanges and public blockchains, thousands of digital tokens, and tens of thousands of digital asset exchanges operate in an inefficient patchwork of systems. As a result, international trading and payment settlement systems are too complicated, slow and expensive. Traditional and digital assets and payments cannot be easily and quickly transferred between these fragmented markets, countries, and trading and settlement systems. A more simple, flexible and faster approach is needed -- one that can be customized to meet the specific needs of banks, digital asset exchanges and trading institutions. Enter Apifiny, a cutting-edge network that unlocks and accelerates new value by unifying disparate trading and settlement systems across the global financial system.', 'Apifiny is a leading fintech company that is building a new internet of finance. The company is focused on providing simple, fast, and flexible trading, liquidity, and settlement solutions for trading institutions, digital asset exchanges and banks anywhere in the world.', 'Assist in resolving business issues using systems and data']

['NP Group is exclusively partnering with a leading multinational enterprise software vendor to find a Senior Data Migration Analyst for the North America region. The position was created due to rising demand and the company’s recent business growth. The company’s products have been known for the efficiency, speed, agility and value for money they can bring to their customers’ business processes, and they are launching a new market-leading student management system for the Education sector.', '• Lead the identification of process improvements and changes to our methodology based on project experience', '• 5+ years’ experience with SQL', '• Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamically changing environment', '• 5+ years in a technical data migration role supporting implementations of a SaaS ERP or Student Information System', '• Experience with at least 2 full life cycle ERP or Student Information System implementations in a Data Conversion role', '• Responsible for timely identification and escalation of risks and development of alternative technical and functional approaches when necessary.', '• Converting and preparing data import files to be loaded into the system using available loading tools; or by partnering with our Global Delivery Center (GDC) organization to extract, load, transform and validate the data.', 'The role encompasses end-to-end management for converting data from legacy systems and spreadsheets into the student management system. The Senior Data Migration Analyst will partner with customers as well as project managers, functional implementation consultants, offshore data conversion and reporting consultants on one or more project teams. The role will require sound technical experience and skills, as well as outstanding interpersonal and communication skills. This is a client-facing analyst position and you will also take up customer engagement responsibilities. ', 'Responsibilities of the Senior Data Migration Analyst ', '\xa0', '• Lead the validation of data loaded into the system and communicate with project and client team to ensure data anomalies are identified and resolved', '• 5+ years of previous experience with a consulting/SaaS software company', '• Previous experience of implementing regulatory reporting for US and/or Canadian Student Information Systems is a plus', '• 5+ years of Student Information Systems related experience in data migration/conversion in a SaaS environment', '• Partnering with customers as well as Project Managers, functional Implementation Consultants, offshore Data Conversion and Reporting consultants on one or more project teams, you will be the primary knowledge source for converting data from legacy systems and spreadsheets into the student management system and have overall responsibility for data conversion activities on the project(s).', '• Demonstrated client- facing experience by partnering with customers to drive successful outcomes', '• Collaborate with client counterpart to successfully deliver on shared objectives', '• Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training', '• Updating validation matrix to ensure that all data checks have been identified and are performed in a consistent and thorough manner', 'Qualifications of the Senior Data Migration Analyst: ', '• Responsible for key communication to project and client leadership', '• Create ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) scripts to transform and load data into the system. ', '• Contribute to the development of and further enhancement of available ETL tools in an effort to standardize and streamline data conversion practices', '• Assisting clients in mapping legacy data and identifying data quality issues']

job_title: Media Solutions Manager, Digital Analyst - Denver
job_text: ['', ' Review, analyze and present qualitative and quantitative analysis and data to internal and external stakeholders', ' Work with cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of analytics projects & initiatives', '  Efficient - Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; values times; concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; gets more done in less time than others; can attend to a broader range of activities', 'What You Bring', ' Strong knowledge of multiple digital channels and how they work together (SEM, SEO, CRO, Social, Shopping, Display, etc.)', ' Relationship Builder', ' Digital Analyst ', ' 2021 Ad Age Best Places to Work  2020 Finalist Digiday Worklife Awards  2020 AdExchanger Programmatic Power Player  2020 MarTech breakthrough awards', ' Proficient using Tableau Software, SQL ', ' Experience working with and utilizing Google Analytics and attribution solutions', 'Description', " Goodway Group is #3 on AdAge's Best Places to Work!", ' 4+ years of marketing, web, or customer analytics experience  Strong knowledge of multiple digital channels and how they work together (SEM, SEO, CRO, Social, Shopping, Display, etc.)  Experience across various verticals including e-commerce and lead generation  Strong analytical skills, proficient with Microsoft Excel and data analysis  Proficient using Tableau Software, SQL   Experience working with and utilizing Google Analytics and attribution solutions  Effective time management and project management skills  Past role experience with marketing analysis role, specifically with paid media platforms (programmatic, search, social)- need to see examples (white label examples)', ' Support the building of analytical capabilities and solutions (segmentation, modeling, campaign evaluations, etc.) that enable analytics to support the strategic goals of the Company', ' 2020 MarTech breakthrough awards', "  Customer-Centric - Dedicated to meeting and exceeding expectations to customers, establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers   Relationship Builder - Finds common ground/solves problems for the good of all, solves problems with peers, is a team player, collaborates, and supports peers.   Focused on Outcomes - Spends his/her time and the time of others on what's important; quickly zeroes in on the critical few and puts the trivial many aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; eliminates roadblocks; creates focus   Drives for Results - Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results   Efficient - Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; values times; concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; gets more done in less time than others; can attend to a broader range of activities", ' Experience across various verticals including e-commerce and lead generation', ' Effective time management and project management skills', ' Past role experience with marketing analysis role, specifically with paid media platforms (programmatic, search, social)- need to see examples (white label examples)', '  Relationship Builder - Finds common ground/solves problems for the good of all, solves problems with peers, is a team player, collaborates, and supports peers.', ' Collects data to measure & analyze return-on-investment across several key marketing and business initiatives  Perform campaign data analysis to understand the lift & ROI associated with each program to aid in the development of future strategies  Provide recommendations on analytical methodologies and frameworks to be utilized for various analytical projects  Work with cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of analytics projects & initiatives  Generate reports, documentation, and insights as part of the analysis process. Produce expected performance measures including lifts, efficiencies, and other measures  Execute appropriate quality control procedures for analysis, reporting, and data visualization for accuracy  Support the building of analytical capabilities and solutions (segmentation, modeling, campaign evaluations, etc.) that enable analytics to support the strategic goals of the Company  Review, analyze and present qualitative and quantitative analysis and data to internal and external stakeholders  Ensure quality and timeliness of deliverables that meet expectations while balancing business needs with the appropriate level of analytical rigor  Leverage story-telling skills to deliver insights that are clear, concise, and actionable', ' Customer-Centric', ' 2020 Finalist Digiday Worklife Awards', ' Perform campaign data analysis to understand the lift & ROI associated with each program to aid in the development of future strategies', ' Collects data to measure & analyze return-on-investment across several key marketing and business initiatives', 'Recent Accolades', 'Who We Are', ' 4+ years of marketing, web, or customer analytics experience', ' Fully remote for 12+ years, Goodway has an award-winning virtual culture, and is growing! This position can be located anywhere in the United States but will be serving our West Coast teams so PST is ideal.
