company: The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory
job_text: ['Have experience in early concept development, developing system requirements, performing functional analysis and allocation, and conducting trade studies in support of the design, development, and evaluation of complex systems. ', 'You will develop innovative digital engineering and mission engineering solutions to critical challenges. ', 'Have relevant Object Management Group (OMG) or other systems engineering certifications.', 'Have 5+ years of professional experience in systems engineering work.', 'Have an advanced degree in systems engineering, computer science, physics, mathematics, statistics, or other engineering discipline. ', 'Have experience with DoD acquisition processes.', "Have a Bachelor's degree in computer science, physics, mathematics, statistics, or related technical field.", 'You will develop model profiles, tool plug-ins, architecture frameworks, and model queries in MBSE tools that capture and analyze models of the systems being developed throughout their lifecycle from concept definition through fielding and support.', 'Your primary responsibility will be to apply mission engineering and systems engineering principles through thought leadership, and expertise to the design, development, and evaluation of complex precision strike systems through systems modeling, parametric analyses, and design trades using advanced digital engineering and MBSE processes and techniques. ', 'You will apply software development to complex digital engineering and/or visualization challenges. You meet our minimum qualifications for the job if you...', 'Have direct experience applying aspects of MBSE in support of system development. ', "Are able to obtain a Secret security clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a Government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship. You'll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you...", 'Have shown the ability to interact effectively with diverse, multidisciplinary teams, including industry and Government sponsors.', "Hold an active Secret clearance. Why work at APL? The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) brings world-class expertise to our nation's most critical defense, security, space and science challenges. While we are dedicated to solving complex challenges and pioneering new technologies, what makes us truly outstanding is our culture. We offer a vibrant, welcoming atmosphere where you can bring your authentic self to work, continue to grow, and build strong connections with inspiring teammates. At APL, we celebrate our differences and encourage creativity and bold, new ideas. Our employees enjoy generous benefits, including a robust education assistance program, unparalleled retirement contributions, and a healthy work/life balance. APL's campus is located in the Baltimore-Washington metro area. Learn more about our career opportunities at http://www.jhuapl.edu/careers.", "You will develop concepts to tie together systems models, analytical tools and visualization environments to support the development of digital threads across systems' lifecycle. ", 'Have strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong critical thinking skills. ', 'Have experience in system modeling using UML/SysML and associated modeling software such as Cameo, Rhapsody, or SPARX EA.', 'You will apply your systems engineering expertise on requirements analysis, concept/technology development, architecture analysis, risk assessments, and test & evaluation for precision strike systems.', 'You will deliver formal presentations to sponsors and supporting contractors, and effectively communicate proposed concepts/solutions and analysis results. ', 'Have worked with modeling frameworks such as the Department of Defense Architecture Framework or Unified Architecture Framework. ', 'Have expertise using and/or writing custom scripts and/or plug-ins for Cameo modeling software and DOORS requirements software. ', 'Have experience with software development and familiarity with developing visualizations of complex data.', 'Have familiarity with NAVAIR and Air Force acquisition programs. ', 'Have experience applying your field of interest (software development, physics, mathematics, cognitive engineering, game theory, statistics, etc.) to digital engineering applications.', 'Have experience integrating physics-based models with a SysML-based system model.']

job_title: Operations/Data Analyst- Behavioral Health Community Partners Program-Worcester County
job_text: ['Overview', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Qualifications', " Bachelor's degree in human/social services, healthcare, or related field , Masters in Public/Business Administration, Public Health, Healthcare Management, or Health Informatics preferred ", ' Two years plus experience required in the following areas: reception, patient accounting, electronic health records . ', ' Interpret, process, and disseminate information from incoming daily, weekly, and monthly reports from MassHealth using SFTP, Microsoft Excel, and Electronic Health Records ', ' Order, distribute, and maintain all program resources and supplies including technological devices ', 'Operations/Data Analyst ', ' Work closely with the Program Director and under supervision of the Director of Integrative Care Management ', ' Must be able to pass a CORI background check ', ' Manage roster of 1,000 clients and upload to MassHealth and program affiliates such as Event Notification System and Technical Assistance vendors ', 'Benefits', " Process all incoming referrals and track status of each member's progress in the program after referral ", ' Respects diverse views and approaches, demonstrates Standards of Respect, and contributes to creating and maintaining an environment of professionalism, tolerance, civility and acceptance toward all employees, patients and visitors ', 'Behavioral Health Community Partner (BHCP) program', ' Serve as a liaison between staff, clients, insurance companies, and MassHealth ', ' Interpret and prepare client and programmatic data for internal and external meetings ', ' Ensure effective and efficient day-to-day operations of a 1,000 member outpatient behavioral health care coordination program in accordance with MassHealth guidelines ', ' Point-person for office/building management, program policies, and emergency procedures ', 'If applicable, Community Healthlink shall also abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals on the basis of disability. These regulations require affirmative action by Community Healthlink to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.', " Two years plus experience required in the following areas: reception, patient accounting, electronic health records .  Bachelor's degree in human/social services, healthcare, or related field , Masters in Public/Business Administration, Public Health, Healthcare Management, or Health Informatics preferred  Must be able to pass a CORI background check ", " Work closely with the Program Director and under supervision of the Director of Integrative Care Management  Ensure effective and efficient day-to-day operations of a 1,000 member outpatient behavioral health care coordination program in accordance with MassHealth guidelines  Serve as a liaison between staff, clients, insurance companies, and MassHealth  Process all incoming referrals and track status of each member's progress in the program after referral  Order, distribute, and maintain all program resources and supplies including technological devices  Interpret, process, and disseminate information from incoming daily, weekly, and monthly reports from MassHealth using SFTP, Microsoft Excel, and Electronic Health Records  Manage roster of 1,000 clients and upload to MassHealth and program affiliates such as Event Notification System and Technical Assistance vendors  Point-person for office/building management, program policies, and emergency procedures  Interpret and prepare client and programmatic data for internal and external meetings  Respects diverse views and approaches, demonstrates Standards of Respect, and contributes to creating and maintaining an environment of professionalism, tolerance, civility and acceptance toward all employees, patients and visitors "]

['', 'Complete Description:', 'The Business Systems Consultant serves as a business analyst for projects involving critical data processing systems for the New Jersey Judiciary.', 'Experience analyzing existing reports (traditional, interactive and dashboard formats) for gaps, enhancements, consolidation, replacement or sunsettin - Required - 5 Years', 'Experience utilizing SQL to query raw system data - Desired - 3 Years', '- Assesses target audiences of reports and compares to current audiences, ensuring data access security protocols are followed.', '- REQUIRED EDUCATION: 4-year college degree', 'Experience working with sensitive data and related security protocols for documentation, presentations, and data redaction - Required - 3 Years', 'Responsibilities:', '- Ensures all documentation complies with data security policies and procedures for purposes of redaction.', '- RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE: 5 to 8 years', 'The Judiciary is seeking a skilled and experienced consultant to catalog and document existing reports and make recommendations for enhancements.', '- Excellent communication, documentation skills, and attention to detail are required.', 'Experience creating reference documentation, templates, and training materials for reports. - Required - 5 Years', '- Provides assessments to business or data analysts to formulate an action plan to develop detailed requirements for changes, including report enhancements.', 'Experience creating webpages in SharePoint and modifying HTML - Required - 4 Years', 'Document an inventory of existing reports, dashboards and data products across different platforms and domains, assessing the purposes of the reports, identifying where improvements are needed and obsolete reports. Facilitate discussions with Subject Matter Experts, end-users of reports, and technical staff to derive detailed information as to the reporting criteria and intended purpose. Create and populate templates to capture report details for both tracking the documentation and as a resource to end-users. Create training materials (documentation and presentations) for different levels of audiences and conduct training. Generate high-level requirements for proposed report modifications as a preliminary step to the business analysis phase.', '- Develops a method of capturing all report information in a repository (SharePoint or other HTML based format) for a wide array of users.', '- Creates detailed catalog of reports including domain, platform, frequency, audience, action items, usability, recipients, recommended changes, next steps.', '- Creates reference documents to be used as a resource for end-users.', 'Experience creating document repositories. - Required - 3 Years', 'Experience facilitating interviews with and follow-ups with subject matter experts and IT staff to elicit purposes and action items related to reports - Required - 5 Years', '- Facilitates and/or participates in routine meetings to review catalog and report materials with various management teams.', 'Experience facilitating and or participating in routine meetings to review catalog and report materials with various management teams. - Required - 5 Years', 'Experience providing report assessments to business or data analysts to create detailed requirements for changes. - Required - 3 Years', 'We are looking to on-board a report analyst professional to assist with multiple initiatives, including:', 'Experience in training end-users on reports - Required - 3 Years', '- Analyzes existing reports (traditional, interactive and dashboard formats) for gaps, enhancements, consolidation, replacement or sunsetting.', '- Creates templates for capturing basic report information to be used for existing and future reports.', '- Facilitates interviews and follow-ups with Subject Matter Experts and technical staff to elicit purposes and action items related to existing reports.', '- Develops methods to ensure future reports are routinely added to the repository and related documentation.', '- Develops end-user training materials and conducts end-user training on reports.', 'Experience creating detailed lists of reports: domain, platform, frequency, audience, action items, usability, recipient, make recommendations - Required - 5 Years']

job_title: Mid-Level Business Analyst - $80K - $120K + Benefits + 401K | Exciting Logisticsand Supply Chain Integration Software Company
job_text: ['With pre-built interfaces to common TMS’s, booking platforms, accounting tools, and eCommerce shopping carts, integrations can be set up in as little as 10 minutes.', 'The Chain.io Platform is the Key to a Client’s Success', 'Company Description', 'Chain.io handles all the complexities of transforming messages to the trading partners’ preferred formats.', 'Advanced technical skills, including familiarity with a wide variety of data file types such as XML and JSON.', 'Team player willing to collaborate with others to achieve desired outcome.', 'Work closely with Project Management and Development team to provide timely updates.', 'Companies dealing with challenges around APIs, XML, EDI, JSON - Chain.io’s any-to-any model extracts the key business concepts like bill of lading numbers, INCO terms and part numbers into a standard industry-wide data structure that we can then output in your trading partner’s preferred format even if it’s nothing like the data you originally provided. ', 'Chain.io then took that knowledge and built an industry-best integration platform from the ground up to solve the unique challenges of the supply chain industry.', 'Review or create customer document specifications. ', 'Challenges and Issues that the Chain.io Platform Solves', 'Document and communicate the results of your efforts.', "YOU MUST BE A CITIZEN OF THE UNITED STATES, HAVE YOUR GREEN CARD OR LONG TERM VISA TO APPLY TO THIS POSITION***YOU CAN WORK FROM ANYWHERE IN THE US WITHIN THE CST AND EST TIME ZONE. ARE YOU READY TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE FUTURE OF HOW LOGISTICS AND SUPPLY CHAIN COMPANIES INCLUDING 3PLS, DIGITAL FORWARDERS, SHIPPERS AND SAAS PROVIDERS INTEGRATE WITH TRADING PARTNERS?Chain.io is one of the fastest growing logistics technology software companies and has developed an industry leading serverless logistics integration software platform for 3PLs, Digital Forwarders, Shippers and SAAS providers who need to integrate with trading partners.Clients connect their ERP, TMS, WMS, BI platform or other systems to Chain.io’s cloud based logistics integration software platform and Chain.io handles communicating with the world.Whether their client’s system communicates in legacy EDI, flat files, XML or the latest and greatest JSON APIs, Chain.io has the solution to solve the problem.Once a client is connected to Chain.io’s platform, they have access to best practice based integration solutions for sharing purchase orders, ASNs, status updates, documents, invoices, and more.Chain.io handles all the complexities of transforming messages to the trading partners’ preferred formats.The Chain.io Platform is the Key to a Client’s SuccessChain.io’s team of supply chain experts has spent decades learning industry best practices inside logistics, retail and software companies to build the ideal software platform.Chain.io then took that knowledge and built an industry-best integration platform from the ground up to solve the unique challenges of the supply chain industry.The platform reduces complexity and allows a client to configure connections for common integrations like Purchase Orders, Bookings, ASNs and Invoices with a simple point and click interface.With pre-built interfaces to common TMS’s, booking platforms, accounting tools, and eCommerce shopping carts, integrations can be set up in as little as 10 minutes.Challenges and Issues that the Chain.io Platform SolvesCompanies building their own software - As a software product company, we understand how hard it is to balance product enhancements with custom client integration works. With the Chain.io OEM program, we build a one time set of integrations to SaaS or installed applications and then handle all aspects of integrating to customers software.Companies dealing with challenges around APIs, XML, EDI, JSON - Chain.io’s any-to-any model extracts the key business concepts like bill of lading numbers, INCO terms and part numbers into a standard industry-wide data structure that we can then output in your trading partner’s preferred format even if it’s nothing like the data you originally provided. Companies building EDI and API Integrations on their own - All of Chain.io’s customers benefit from the common integrations they’ve built to many industry leading solutions. By running on Chain.io’s cloud platform, clients can leverage the technology to quickly onboard new customers and trading partners without the typical integration project headaches.Custom Integrations - Chain.io’s microservice architecture allows them to build single use integration endpoints and even fully customized business processes. Job DescriptionWhen Chain onboards a new client, your role is critical to making sure they are successful with Chain software and you are the bridge between the client and our development team. You will perform detailed requirements analysis, data mappings, document processes, and perform some user acceptance testing. To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to both technical and non-technical users. Familiarity with supply chain and logistics operations, systems and EDI standards required.Evaluate supply chain business processes, anticipating requirements, and capturing technical solutions.Perform requirements analysis to create Statements of Work, User stories, and other technical documentation.Review or create customer document specifications. Create data transformation mapping documents.Document and communicate the results of your efforts.Effectively communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and produce useful documentation.Work closely with Project Management and Development team to provide timely updates.Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements.Perform user acceptance testing.Configuration, communication setup and testing.Monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion of tasks/projects.Execute post implementation support on completed projects. You will report to the VP of Solutions. QualificationsA minimum of 3+ years Supply Chain experience in business analysis or an IT related field.Experience analyzing EDI specifications a plus.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.Advanced technical skills, including familiarity with a wide variety of data file types such as XML and JSON.Excellent documentation skills.Team player willing to collaborate with others to achieve desired outcome.Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.A history of leading and supporting successful projects.Additional InformationProcess for InterviewingPlease submit your resume by clicking “I’m Interested”If you don’t have a resume, but are interested and meet the requirements, respond to one of our messages to you over email or LinkedIn.Phone Interview by Michael C. Bertoni - Recruiting Lead at Chain.ioPhone Interview with Chain.io VP of SolutionsInterview with VP of Solutions and CEO / Founder of Chain.ioOfferChain.io Headquarters, Compensation And Benefits OverviewHeadquarters at 1518 Walnut Street in Philadelphia and is situated in one of the best areas of Philadelphia / Rittenhouse Square and can be easily accessed from SEPTA trains to Suburban Station, SEPTA buses and PATCO.Our Brand and Culture is more than how we market our products; it's a way of thinking and a way of acting. It pervades everything we do, from the way we hold meetings, how we write our documentation, to how we present our internal accounting documents. We believe in 3 main principles - Nice, Accessible and Professional at all times.Our salary is extremely competitive based on prior skills and experience and we give our employees a flexible work schedule, where you have the ability to work remotely and set your own work hours.PTO overview - you are required to use at least 10 days per year with a soft ceiling of 20 days (very flexible if you need to go over).We offer you subsidized Health and Dental insurance as well as 401K.We give you the opportunity to be reimbursed for conferences and professional development.", 'A minimum of 3+ years Supply Chain experience in business analysis or an IT related field.', 'Experience analyzing EDI specifications a plus.', 'Execute post implementation support on completed projects. ['', 'Experience taking a quantitative approach to problem solving\xa0', 'Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing', 'Own all data and KPI related activities for Services - supporting 4 business lines Mortgage, Insurance, Title Insurance and Escrow, Home ServicesPlay a key stakeholder role in developing and updating the company financial model and projections\xa0Help to set Services business goals with the Sales Ops team and Services Leaders and drive a regular cadence for ops review meetingsCreate and own work streams on data reconciliation between Salesforce and data systems for each ServiceResponsible for managing offshore analysts in data reconciliation and audit projects\xa0Provide financial, analytical modeling, detailed due diligence and strategic support for evaluating potential M&A candidates, joint venture partners, and business development growth initiatives', 'REX is a well-funded, game-changing real estate technology startup with offices in Austin, Los Angeles, and the Bay Area. With the goal of improving the lives of homebuyers and sellers, REX created a digital platform and real estate service that eliminates traditional agent commissions and shifts control away from agents over to those who matter most: consumers! REX saves home sellers thousands of dollars in fees by going around the MLS to target home-buyers directly with sophisticated marketing that has never been used in real estate. Since its launch in Southern California, REX has expanded to 17 states and over 300 employees. Throughout the years, REX has represented homes cumulatively valued at over $1 billion and in the process, saved customers over $30 million in fees they otherwise would have paid traditional brokers.', 'About Us:', 'Minimum 2 years of experience in investment banking, FinOps, and/or FP&ABachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience\xa0Experience taking a quantitative approach to problem solving\xa0Previous experience with data entry, workflows, and reporting in Salesforce or another similar CRM\xa0Strong financial modeling expertiseAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing', 'As a Senior Analyst - Services & Business Development at REX, you will be responsible for the accuracy and maintenance of sales data within our CRM and reporting tools. This role will work closely with the Services Business lines (Mortgage, Insurance, Title & Escrow and Home Services) as well as cross functionally with the Sales, Operations, Data Science, Finance and Business Development organizations.\xa0', "What You'll Do:", 'Play a key stakeholder role in developing and updating the company financial model and projections\xa0', 'Provide financial, analytical modeling, detailed due diligence and strategic support for evaluating potential M&A candidates, joint venture partners, and business development growth initiatives', 'Help to set Services business goals with the Sales Ops team and Services Leaders and drive a regular cadence for ops review meetings', 'Listed below are just some of the awesome perks available when joining REX:', 'Strong financial modeling expertise', '-Open and flexible PTO plan', 'The successful candidate thrives at problem solving, working in a fast-paced environment and is comfortable with managing large sets of data. In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to be exposed to how business line leaders set vision and strategy and also how they evaluate key decisions for the future of the business. This position will be based out of Redwood City, CA', 'Who We Are:', 'Rewards*', '*Some perks do not apply to contract workers or interns', 'U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Information', '-Parental leave\xa0', 'Create and own work streams on data reconciliation between Salesforce and data systems for each Service', "REX sets aside a portion of all income from selling homes to fund homes for families in dire need. It is our mission to contribute one home for every 50 homes we sell. We started in Sihanoukville, Cambodia, where we partnered with World Housing and the Cambodian Children's Fund to help homeless families get back on their feet. To learn more, please visit\xa0https://www.rexhomes.com/rex-social-mission.", "What You'll Need:", 'Minimum 2 years of experience in investment banking, FinOps, and/or FP&A', 'We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, citizenship, age, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.', 'Social Mission:\xa0', '-Cell phone & Internet reimbursement for some roles', '-Competitive base & bonus packages', 'Own all data and KPI related activities for Services - supporting 4 business lines Mortgage, Insurance, Title Insurance and Escrow, Home Services', "At REX, we appreciate diverse perspectives and want each person to feel valued and impactful in their work. We believe in nurturing your career growth at a fast pace and giving recognition where it's due!\xa0", 'Responsible for managing offshore analysts in data reconciliation and audit projects\xa0', '-Employer discounts on select home services', '-Career growth opportunities\xa0', 'Previous experience with data entry, workflows, and reporting in Salesforce or another similar CRM\xa0', 'REX offers its staff amazing latitude to learn new skills, solve interesting problems and grow with the company as it expands geographically and adds new businesses. Come work with dynamic leaders who have been drawn to REX from top companies across the U.S.', 'Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience\xa0', '-Benefits, including medical, dental & vision insurance, as well as 401(k)']

job_title: Data Analyst - Utilization / Healthcare (Dental Experience Required)
job_text: ['', 'Essential Responsibilities:', 'advanced Excel ', 'analysis of data', 'Prepare meeting minutes and maintain supporting documentation for DCM committee meetings in accordance with the company’s guidelines', 'Strong data analysis/data mining skills.', 'Highly analytical', 'Review documentation from other departments for regulatory and internal compliance and provide feedback to management', 'Generate applicable claims reports as needed for Dental Directors to review offices with potential utilization issues', 'data mining', 'LIBERTY Dental Plan is an Equal Opportunity Employer.', 'Specific Skills/Knowledge:', 'Prepare and summarize DCM activities and present to committees, clients, management, and regulators as requested', 'OR', 'Excel ', 'Ability to define problems, collect relevant data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.', 'Work with IT on various projects as needed and perform user acceptance testing when necessary to implement system enhancements', 'data analysis', 'Ability to prioritize and successfully manage multiple projects and ad hoc requests.', 'Highly analytical and detail-oriented with ability to demonstrate command of details and to articulate those details at a higher level.', 'Research and respond to requests for information in connection with RFPs, regulatory inquiries, and special projects', 'Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills with ability to effectively represent the company with all internal and external customers.', "Bachelor's Degree from a four-year college or university and 3+ years of related experience; OR equivalent combination of education and experience.", 'Collaborate with Dental Directors or clinicians on recommended actions and follow through to ensure appropriate next steps are taken within the established timeframe', 'Education and/or Experience:', 'No relocation assistance or sponsorship available at this time.', 'Knowledge of dental terminology and procedure codes.', 'Intermediate to advanced skills in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; advanced Excel skills preferred.', 'Oversee tracking, scheduling, and analysis of data related to DCM audits', 'dental terminology ', 'Sponsorship and Relocation Specifications:', 'Prepare reports by collecting and analyzing information, or by clearly communicating report parameters and objectives to internal subject matter experts', 'dental ', 'Analyze utilization data, research, and identify potential patterns; this includes data mining, understanding benefit plans and provider networks within the assigned markets, and recommending appropriate next actions according to findingsGenerate applicable claims reports as needed for Dental Directors to review offices with potential utilization issuesCollaborate with Dental Directors or clinicians on recommended actions and follow through to ensure appropriate next steps are taken within the established timeframeDemonstrate ability to use Excel to sort, summarize, and calculate totals as necessary to review data and understand resultsPrepare and summarize DCM activities and present to committees, clients, management, and regulators as requestedOversee tracking, scheduling, and analysis of data related to DCM auditsReview documentation from other departments for regulatory and internal compliance and provide feedback to managementPrepare meeting minutes and maintain supporting documentation for DCM committee meetings in accordance with the company’s guidelinesResearch and respond to requests for information in connection with RFPs, regulatory inquiries, and special projectsPrepare reports by collecting and analyzing information, or by clearly communicating report parameters and objectives to internal subject matter expertsWork with IT on various projects as needed and perform user acceptance testing when necessary to implement system enhancements', 'Analyze utilization data, research, and identify potential patterns; this includes data mining, understanding benefit plans and provider networks within the assigned markets, and recommending appropriate next actions according to findings', "The Dental Care Management Analyst is responsible for the day-to-day activities that support LIBERTY Dental Plan's Dental Care Management program and initiatives. The DCM Analyst needs to be familiar with dental terminology and procedures, experienced working in a fast-paced environment, and comfortable interacting with internal and external staff at various levels. Must function effectively and efficiently under pressure while remaining flexible and open to change. The role requires data mining and understanding of utilization patterns.", 'Knowledge of dental terminology and procedure codes.Strong data analysis/data mining skills.Intermediate to advanced skills in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; advanced Excel skills preferred.Ability to prioritize and successfully manage multiple projects and ad hoc requests.Ability to define problems, collect relevant data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.Highly analytical and detail-oriented with ability to demonstrate command of details and to articulate those details at a higher level.Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills with ability to effectively represent the company with all internal and external customers.', 'Demonstrate ability to use Excel to sort, summarize, and calculate totals as necessary to review data and understand results']

['', 'Ability to host efficient and business requirements sessions and drive towards agreed upon scope and outcomes essential.', 'Covers all aspects of the Software Development Lifecycle with respect to data warehousing and reporting solutions. Requirements analysis, report content identification and report functionality analysis, SDLC documentation, and other recommend designs/solutions will be necessary to meet business or other requirements.', 'Experience working with Sr. and Executive management is a must. Must be able to efficiently drive project-scoping discussions and effectively negotiate and close on scope with Sr. leadership.', 'Excellent analytical and technical skills in varied IT technologies. Proficient in software/hardware enterprise technologies, systems integrations and software/hardware release to production methodologies, etc.', 'Excellent complex problem-solving skills.', 'Document business requirements (BRDs) and functional design specifications (FRDs) for conversions, interfaces and reports.', 'Coordinate and drive issue resolution with cross-functional teams during the design and development process.', 'Prepare and execute test plans to ensure solution/design meet business requirements.', 'Perform evaluations of data and data structures from disparate systems.', 'Role And Responsibilities', 'Ability to access and analyze data in complex data models with little supervision or input is a must.', 'Determine and recommend reporting enhancements or improvements for existing as well as new processes through the use of enterprise business intelligence tools to enhance the analysis capability or operational efficiency of various business units within the organization. This includes working across business areas, applications, data domains and technologies.', ' Ability to perform hands-on, SQL-level evaluations of data models supporting front-line business-systems. This includes reverse engineering data models at the table and column level when working with transactional systems (3NF) and Kimball-Dimensional models. Applicant must be comfortable analyzing not only complex data models but other data structures such as delimited and XML file-based data structures. Using industry best practices, applicant must have relevant experience translating business requirements into business intelligence visualizations for cloud-based analytics and reporting. Hands-on experience working with cloud based BI solutions such as Microsoft Power BI desired. Other relevant experience with Microstrategy, Tableau or other similar analytics platforms also relevant. Working knowledge and relevant analysis experience utilizing industry leading database, data integration and data analytics platforms such as Informatica, Oracle, SQL Server, R, and SAS desired. Drive efficient and effective joint business/IT requirements and solution discussions in addition to stakeholder review meetings Experience working with Sr. and Executive management is a must. Must be able to efficiently drive project-scoping discussions and effectively negotiate and close on scope with Sr. leadership. Proven leadership of business intelligence and analytic initiatives in fast paced multiple project environment. Covers all aspects of the Software Development Lifecycle with respect to data warehousing and reporting solutions. Requirements analysis, report content identification and report functionality analysis, SDLC documentation, and other recommend designs/solutions will be necessary to meet business or other requirements. Determine and recommend reporting enhancements or improvements for existing as well as new processes through the use of enterprise business intelligence tools to enhance the analysis capability or operational efficiency of various business units within the organization. This includes working across business areas, applications, data domains and technologies. Document business requirements (BRDs) and functional design specifications (FRDs) for conversions, interfaces and reports. Identify functional gaps and opportunities of improvement. Coordinate and drive issue resolution with cross-functional teams during the design and development process. Work closely with users to define and document use cases, scenarios and test scripts. Prepare and execute test plans to ensure solution/design meet business requirements. Create documentation for processes, training and operational support. Ensure requirements are delivered in timely stages, allowing the design and development to make the necessary progress. Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal laws and regulations related to credit union compliance including bank secrecy and anti-money laundering laws appropriate to the position. Ensure solutions within the environment follow established guidelines, policies and technical frameworks. Perform evaluations of data and data structures from disparate systems. Proactively seek opportunities to understand and improve business processes through data business intelligence and data analytics. Act as liaison between business clients and technical staff throughout the life cycle of projects or process improvements. Coordinate effectively with IT and other departmental projects analysts and managers. ['', '9.Conducts peer analyses;', '7.Works with technology specialists to ensure the ALLL reports are accurate;', 'SUMMARY', '1.Uses proprietary software and Excel to perform regular loss estimation calculations;', '17.May train, delegate and oversee the work of coworkers who perform similar duties.', '•Intermediate typing skills to meet production needs of the position.', '10.Documents all components of the ALLL;', '•Strong problem solving, analytical and decision making skills.', '•Current driver’s license and a vehicle with appropriate insurance coverage if required to drive in the course of performing assigned duties and responsibilities.', '•Able to handle multiple transactions at once and work well in a team-oriented environment', '14.Reviews the report/data that credit risk model analyst generated; Loan Maturity List, Daily Delinquency, FHLB Pledged Loan list update', "•Bachelor's degree preferred with an emphasis in Finance, Accounting or Economics; High School Diploma and 5 or more years of related experience and/or training. Work related experience must consist of a credit analysis or other credit related background. Educational experience, through in-house training sessions, formal school or financial industry related curriculum, should be business or financial industry related.", '2.Reviews ALLL models and procedures, recommending enhancements, and implementing improvements to the process;', 'This position is based in our Los Angeles, CA office. Interviews for this position will be conducted on site. Please review the position description below before applying.', '18.Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works ethically and with integrity; upholds organizational values; accepts responsibility for own actions.', 'The Senior Credit Risk Analyst is responsible for conducting the more complex credit analyses including gathering, analyzing and interpreting credit information on prospective customers. Monitors loan portfolios in order to maximize credit quality and minimize risk and potential loss. Maintains control over the credit standings of accounts and furnishes information relative to credit inquiries, as appropriate.', '15.Provides guidance on credit dispute process on need basis', 'MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS', '•Basic math skills; ability to calculate interest, commissions, proportions, and percentages; balance accounts; add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals; locate routine mathematical errors; compute rate, ratio and percent, including the drafting and interpretation of bar graphs.', '5.Measures and documenting the historic performance of quantitative ALLL models;', '6.Keeps abreast of state of the art credit loss estimation techniques;', 'These specifications are general guidelines based on the minimum experience normally considered essential to the satisfactory performance of this position. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required to perform the position in a satisfactory manner. Individual abilities may result in some deviation from these guidelines.', 'ESSENTIAL DUTIES', '22.Performs duties specific to the position and other functions as assigned.', '21.Performs the position safely, without endangering the health or safety to themselves or others and will be expected to report potentially unsafe conditions. The employee shall comply with occupational safety and health standards and all rules, regulations and orders issued pursuant to the OSHA Act of 1970, which are applicable to one’s own actions and conduct.', 'Ensures compliance with established Bank policies and procedures. Demonstrates knowledge of, adherence to, monitoring and responsibility for compliance with state and federal regulations and laws as they pertain to this position including but not limited to the following: GLBA (Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act), Regulation Z (Truth in Lending Act), Regulation DD (Truth in Savings Act) Regulation B (Equal Credit Opportunity Act), Dodd–Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Dodd Frank Act), Elder Abuse Laws, Bank Secrecy Act in conjunction with the USA PATRIOT Act, Anti-Money Laundering and Customer Information Program, Right to Financial Privacy Act (state and federal) and Community Reinvestment Act.', 'We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable state and local laws and regulations. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.', '•Strong customer service skills, relationship development and management skills', '•Ability to deal with complex problems involving multiple facets and variables in non-standardized situations.', '13.Obtains data to perform portfolio concentration analysis and assist in the preparation on the monthly allowance for loan and lease loss (ALLL).', '3.Responsible for Stress Testing Models', '19.Demonstrates knowledge of and adherence to EEO policy; shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences; educates others on the value of diversity; promotes working environment free of harassment of any type; builds a diverse workforce and supports affirmative action.', '16.Assists in the preparation of any reports required from Credit Administration.', '•Good verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills, with the ability to apply common sense to carry out instructions and instruct others, train personnel, write reports, correspondence and procedures, and speak clearly to customers and employees.', '4.Develops models for new accounting requirements;', '11.Performs SOX controls;', '•Basic skills in computer terminal and personal computer operation; mainframe computer system; word processing and spreadsheet software programs.', '8.Gathers economic data used in the ALLL;', '•Ability to work with no supervision while performing duties.', '20.Follows policies and procedures; completes tasks correctly and on time; supports the company’s goals and values.', '12.Performs special projects as required by senior management:']

['Detailed and results oriented and able to work in a dynamic and fast paced environment', 'Assist in the Company’s external financial reporting process, including quarterly and annual reporting and other financial reporting as required.Prepare and maintain supporting schedules and documentation for external filings, including balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement and statements of stockholders’ equity.Assist with stock-based compensation accounting and forecast.Evaluate applicability of with new accounting standards, particularly those that impact financial reporting.Assist with researching and analyzing technical accounting and financial reporting issues, assessing impact to organization, formalizing positions and recommendations, writing accounting memos and ensure reporting compliance, and providing necessary training to accounting team and foreign finance teams.Assist with implementation of ASC-842.Interact effectively with numerous individuals both inside and outside the Company, including the external auditors, to address and resolve accounting issues.Assist with special projects and ad-hoc requests (e.g. – M&A due diligence, purchase accounting, post-acquisition integrations, assist accounting team as necessary, coordinate with various teams for 409a valuation, etc.', 'Our peninsula-based client seeks a Sr. Analyst, External Reporting and Technical Accounting to join their team. Working as the Senior Analyst-External Reporting and Technical Accounting you must have strong technical, communication, collaboration, and leadership skills. ['', 'Payment technology is constantly evolving, and our associates are up for the challenge. We pride ourselves in our ability to deliver excellent service and support for our vast existing field base, while pushing the envelope of innovation to design and deliver new solutions that reflect the modern payment landscape. ', 'About the role:', 'Paid time off', 'Competitive salariesPaid time offSick time offMedical, dental, & vision insurance Flexible spending accountsLife insurance and disability benefits Onsite gym401K with Company contributionDiscounts for childcareCommunity involvementOpportunities to travel and work at our global sites', 'CPI makes the technology that powers your everyday life. If you’ve ever used a self-checkout, played the slots at a casino, gotten a drink from a vending machine, or paid to park your car, you’ve probably done so with the aid of one of the 10 million devices installed by CPI. From cash and coins to cards and mobile, we keep the world of payments moving with smart validation devices and business-management software. Our technology powers more than 4 billion transactions every week – and we want you to be a part of it.', 'Responsibilities and Duties', 'Up to 10% travel', 'High energy level, comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities ', 'Hands-on P&L responsibility is a plus', 'Why work with us:', 'Our team is searching for a Product Manager to help us build out and bring our next generation of enterprise software to market. We need an individual contributor that can effectively operate at the intersection of business, technology, and user experience. The role requires close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders in order to develop product road maps, generate innovative ideas for new features, and clarify product requirements to ensure that we maximize the value our product delivers to customers.', 'Life insurance and disability benefits ', 'Past work experience with solutions covering any combination of currency handling, electronic payment acceptance, IoT, SaaS, business integration tools, or business intelligence is strongly preferred', 'Team player – able to work in a matrix organization', 'Results and people oriented with sound judgment—ability to balance other business considerations', 'Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required', 'Discounts for childcare', 'Gather and develop business requirements for the Simplifi™ platform, our latest enterprise software offering that provides IoT solutions to customers using our connected hardwareProvide meaningful analysis on the business implications of delivering on business requirements and meeting customer needsWork with business analysts to convert documented requirements into feature-rich backlogs that our scrum teams rely on during the SDLCConvey functional vision for the product to UIUX designers who will bring that vision to life via wireframes and mock-upsPrioritize work in the product backlog and perform data-driven analysis to optimize trade-offs (i.e., Iron Triangle – scope, cost, time)Assist with product showcases, documentation development, and marketing support, as needed, to ensure new product and feature launches are successful', 'Onsite gym', 'At CPI you will become a valuable part of our culture of inclusion and collaboration, working in partnership with more than 3,000 global associates supporting 110 countries and currencies.\xa0If you are interested in making a global impact, we are looking for a full-time Product Manager to join us in our Malvern, PA location.', 'Gather and develop business requirements for the Simplifi™ platform, our latest enterprise software offering that provides IoT solutions to customers using our connected hardware', "Ability to establish credibility and be decisive and able to recognize and support the organization's preferences and priorities", 'Convey functional vision for the product to UIUX designers who will bring that vision to life via wireframes and mock-ups', 'Excellent communication skills verbally and in writing', 'Assist with product showcases, documentation development, and marketing support, as needed, to ensure new product and feature launches are successful', 'Prioritize work in the product backlog and perform data-driven analysis to optimize trade-offs (i.e., Iron Triangle – scope, cost, time)', 'Key Attributes for Success:', 'Sick time off', gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law.', 'Qualifications and Required Skills', '2-3 years of practical product management, product marketing, or business analyst experience is required', 'Experience with the Atlassian suite (e.g., Jira, Confluence) is required', 'Malvern, PA ', 'Excellent influencing skills, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment', 'Crane Co. is a diversified manufacturer of highly engineered industrial products. Founded in 1855, Crane provides products and solutions to customers in the aerospace, electronics, hydrocarbon processing, petrochemical, chemical, power generation, automated merchandising, transportation and other markets. The Company has four business segments: Aerospace & Electronics, Fluid Handling, Engineered Materials, and Merchandising Systems. Crane has approximately 12,000 employees in North America, South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. Crane Co. is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE:CR).', "High energy level, comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities Excellent influencing skills, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environmentAbility to establish credibility and be decisive and able to recognize and support the organization's preferences and prioritiesResults and people oriented with sound judgment—ability to balance other business considerationsTeam player – able to work in a matrix organizationExcellent communication skills verbally and in writing", 'Who we are:', 'Flexible spending accounts', 'Competitive salaries', 'Product Manager ', 'About the team:', 'Work with business analysts to convert documented requirements into feature-rich backlogs that our scrum teams rely on during the SDLC', 'With a 160-year history of innovation and growth, more than 3,000 patents, and an unmatched commitment to success, you are joining a company that has shaped the global landscape of technology. At CPI, you will become a valuable part of an inclusive culture of collaboration and innovation, all while directly impacting global payment solutions. Come see your ideas make change.', 'CPI is a part of CraneCo.', 'Opportunities to travel and work at our global sites', 'Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) is strongly preferred', 'Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required2-3 years of practical product management, product marketing, or business analyst experience is requiredExperience with the Atlassian suite (e.g., Jira, Confluence) is requiredPast work experience with solutions covering any combination of currency handling, electronic payment acceptance, IoT, SaaS, business integration tools, or business intelligence is strongly preferredExperience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) is strongly preferredHands-on P&L responsibility is a plusUp to 10% travel', 'We offer:', 'The product team for enterprise software and services consists of a small group of product managers and product owners located at multiple CPI sites in North America and Europe. The team also works on a daily basis with cross-functional teams that include other product managers/owners, business analysts, UI/UX designers, engineers, software developers, testers, and professional services colleagues in a variety of roles.', '401K with Company contribution', 'Community involvement', 'Provide meaningful analysis on the business implications of delivering on business requirements and meeting customer needs']

job_title: Senior Analyst, Marketing and Digital Analytics
job_text: ['', 'Experience in omni-channel retail a plus', 'Marketing Analytics', 'This position is not available to be performed in Colorado.', 'Rigorous attention to detail', 'Present analytical insights and serve as expert within daily team discussions and formal presentations', 'Develop, automate and maintain detailed/consolidated reporting of KPI metrics against daily forecasts', 'Understanding of data visualization best practices, including direct experience with BI tools (e.g. Tableau)', 'Generate actionable recommendations that are rooted in data and translate findings into engaging, actionable intelligence delivered at the speed of retail', 'Focus on understanding and uplifting the end-to-end customer experience and achieving business resultsSupport and guide marketing and ecommerce teams through the consistent monitoring of marketing acquisition and onsite behavior; Gather signals from critical customer and marketplace dynamicsGenerate actionable recommendations that are rooted in data and translate findings into engaging, actionable intelligence delivered at the speed of retailPresent analytical insights and serve as expert within daily team discussions and formal presentationsMaintain a strong stakeholder network with a high level of trust that facilitates action-ability of insights', 'Self-starter with out-of-the-box problem solving skills who can independently drive results', 'Exceptional understanding of digital landscape (SEM, email, affiliate, display, social etc.) and how all channels work together to create 360 degree impact', 'Transform data into actionable strategic insights and recommendations to optimize customer journey through all stages of the conversion funnel', 'Oversee automation and upkeep of recurring reports to increase departmental and organizational efficiency', 'Reporting to the Director of Analytics, the Senior Analyst role will focus on the intersection of digital marketing, CX and business results to put data at the center of decision making.\xa0You will be a key partner in assessing marketing investment against marketplace dynamics and customer behavior to drive growth in digital commerce performance. This position requires strong collaboration, an in-depth understanding and use of statistical and data analysis tools, as well as strong technical skills and an innate ability to weave together multiple inputs into actionable insights.\xa0', 'The Senior Analyst will work closely with analytics and data peers as well as across marketing, site, product and merchandise teams to support the synthesis of a holistic view of our ecommerce business, including its goals, target customers, strategies, and tactics.\xa0This is an exciting opportunity to affect the brand’s marketing investment, be constantly challenged with complex, interesting, and impactful questions and to help shape cross-channel decision-making.', 'QUALIFICATIONS:', 'Focus on understanding and uplifting the end-to-end customer experience and achieving business results', 'Lead tracking, analysis and reporting on customer behavior and marketing effectiveness on ColeHaan.com including product, promotional and experience performanceTransform data into actionable strategic insights and recommendations to optimize customer journey through all stages of the conversion funnelDevelop, automate and maintain detailed/consolidated reporting of KPI metrics against daily forecastsEnsure the right tracking and data architecture are in place to measure performance and provide analyses, both at a channel level and consolidated level', 'Maintain a strong stakeholder network with a high level of trust that facilitates action-ability of insights', 'Experience with web analytics and marketing tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, BigQuery, Advanced event tracking', 'Support and guide marketing and ecommerce teams through the consistent monitoring of marketing acquisition and onsite behavior; Gather signals from critical customer and marketplace dynamics', 'BA/BS Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Business, Marketing Analytics or other quantitative field preferred)', 'Strategy & Evangelism', '\xa0', 'Advanced knowledge of SQL and Excel, Python knowledge a plus', 'BA/BS Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Business, Marketing Analytics or other quantitative field preferred)5+ years of experience overseeing coordinated delivery of marketing and digital analytics within direct-to-consumer ecommerce environment Experience in omni-channel retail a plusSelf-starter with out-of-the-box problem solving skills who can independently drive resultsExperience with web analytics and marketing tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, BigQuery, Advanced event trackingExceptional understanding of digital landscape (SEM, email, affiliate, display, social etc.) and how all channels work together to create 360 degree impactAdvanced knowledge of SQL and Excel, Python knowledge a plusUnderstanding of data visualization best practices, including direct experience with BI tools (e.g. Tableau)Rigorous attention to detail', 'Own the data business requirements, platform, and instrumentation that power website and marketing analytics, ensuring we are effective and efficient in collecting and organizing the data and models needed to power our analytics', '5+ years of experience overseeing coordinated delivery of marketing and digital analytics within direct-to-consumer ecommerce environment ', 'Digital & CX Analytics', 'Lead projects with the goal of driving return on investment, experimental design, customer behavior, and marketing channel effectiveness', 'Partner with marketing team to develop quantitative analyses, forecasts, and models to support marketing decision-making across upper, mid and lower funnel mediaLead projects with the goal of driving return on investment, experimental design, customer behavior, and marketing ['', 'The Graduate Division is the central resource for all matters related to graduate education at UC San Diego. Our team is there at every step in a graduate student’s career, helping students navigate their path from admission to graduation and beyond. Working behind-the-scenes and in collaboration with faculty, staff and students, The Graduate Division guides today’s scholars on their upward trajectory to becoming tomorrow’s leaders.', 'Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Ability to instruct non-technical users in the use of applications. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in verbally and in writing.', 'Occasional evenings and weekends may be required.', 'Please submit a cover letter for a complete application.', 'Thorough knowledge of business processes and procedures. Working knowledge of educational policies, procedures, and processes in higher education settings, including teaching, research, and professional programs. Strong understanding of university, state, and federal regulations governing graduate and professional student academic studies and financial support.', 'Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Ability to instruct non-technical users in the use of applications. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in verbally and in writing.Strong skills and knowledge of methodologies associated with analysis of processes and problems, information flow and architecture.Broad knowledge relating to software design. Strong analytical skills and capacity to solve complex software problems by finding creative solutions.In-depth understanding and skill in process and systems requirement documentation standards, such as Use Case modeling, User Story creations and narrative description.Demonstrated testing and test planning skills.Proficiency with Structured Query Language (SQL) and data analytic capabilities with the intention of producing datasets that bridge different areas of core functions across campus systems. Ability to build and maintain moderately complex reports with business intelligence/analytics and data visualization tools, such as Cognos or Tableau. Thorough knowledge of business intelligence functions and analytics. Thorough knowledge of relevant internal databases, BI applications and tools. Ability to produce reports and documentation.Demonstrated ability to work with others from diverse backgrounds.Ability to read, understand, and apply the content of technical literature.Thorough knowledge of business processes and procedures. Working knowledge of educational policies, procedures, and processes in higher education settings, including teaching, research, and professional programs. Strong understanding of university, state, and federal regulations governing graduate and professional student academic studies and financial support.Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn effectively and meet deadlines. Proven problem solving skills. Attention to detail, with the ability to adapt to shifting prioritization and demanding time frames. Ability to complete tasks accurately and efficiently. Ability to organize work and prioritize tasks, taking initiative and exercising sound judgment.ormance of job responsibilities.', 'Broad knowledge relating to software design. Strong analytical skills and capacity to solve complex software problems by finding creative solutions.', 'Demonstrated ability to work with others from diverse backgrounds.', 'QUALIFICATIONS', 'Demonstrated testing and test planning skills.', 'Strong skills and knowledge of methodologies associated with analysis of processes and problems, information flow and architecture.', 'ormance of job responsibilities.', 'Under general direction, the Lead Business Configuration and Data Analyst is responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining complex computer-based administrative information systems serving The Graduate Division. The incumbent performs advanced quality assurance and key systems analysis functions in an independent manner with the ability to think quickly as a problem solver. In coordination with the Academic Affairs Information Services (AAIS) group, this position analyzes, develops, tests, implements, and enhances multiple technology systems and corresponding in-house developed programs/apps. Leads configuration, implementation and business process optimization of Enterprise Systems Renewal (ESR) projects (including, but not limited to, the new Student Information System (SIS)) across all units within The Graduate Division. The incumbent works in collaboration with, and receives work direction as appropriate, from the ITS-SIS Service Offering Manager for the Graduate Division.', 'Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn effectively and meet deadlines. Proven problem solving skills. Attention to detail, with the ability to adapt to shifting prioritization and demanding time frames. Ability to complete tasks accurately and efficiently. Ability to organize work and prioritize tasks, taking initiative and exercising sound judgment.', 'Management of such systems is critical to the management of over 8,000 graduate and professional student records. The systems handle vast amounts of high-risk information, requiring attention to detail, constant monitoring, and knowledge of federal, state, and university rules, regulations, and software relating to financial support (including merit- and need-based aid), academic/student affairs, and admissions. Current systems include, but are not limited to: financial and human resource systems (ProSAM and IAM, UCPath, Instructional Assistant (IA), Oracle Financial Cloud), admissions/CRM systems (Slate, ServiceNOW), student systems (ISIS, Blade, OnBase, Student Database). Campus business partners include, but are not limited to: Financial Aid & Scholarships Office, School of Medicine Financial Aid, Student Financial Solutions, Office of the Registrar and various units within Business & Financial Services.', 'In-depth understanding and skill in process and systems requirement documentation standards, such as Use Case modeling, User Story creations and narrative description.', 'The Graduate Division Lead Business Configuration and Data Analyst is an experienced professional who knows how to apply theory and put it into practice with in-depth understanding of the professional field; independently performs the full range of responsibilities within the function; possesses broad job knowledge; analyzes problems / issues of diverse scope and determines solutions. This position applies skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry-wide business process and analysis practices and organizational policies and procedures. Resolves a wide range of business process issues of moderate to complex scope. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions.', 'Proficiency with Structured Query Language (SQL) and data analytic capabilities with the intention of producing datasets that bridge different areas of core functions across campus systems. Ability to build and maintain moderately complex reports with business intelligence/analytics and data visualization tools, such as Cognos or Tableau. Thorough knowledge of business intelligence functions and analytics. Thorough knowledge of relevant internal databases, BI applications and tools. Ability to produce reports and documentation.', 'Ability to read, understand, and apply the content of technical literature.']

['', 'Overview', 'We are looking for strong Solutions Consultant to join our client’s growing team. We are looking for someone who exudes a passion for understanding the needs of customers and articulating the value of services and solutions in meeting those needs.', 'Our client’s data and analytics solutions empower innovation in life sciences across the value chain from “molecule to market.” Their strategic advantage comes from a seamless amalgamation of data, deep domain expertise and data science. The company’s multifaceted team helps harmonize large volumes of disparate unstructured data; analyze data using cutting-edge AI/ML technologies, and galvanize data-driven decisions to unlock operational efficiencies and accelerate drug development. ', ' ', 'As a Solutions Consultant, you will actively drive and manage the solutioning around IT opportunities within the R&D IT side of the life sciences sector (R&D IT). We are seeking an individual with a strong tech background in big data / data & Analytics / and data science.', 'Role Background', 'Details', 'Life Sciences - Solution Architect / Pre-Sales Consultant', 'The Sales Zone, a national search firm with a rich history of helping grow companies and careers through recruiting top talent, is pleased to be engaged by a dynamic, growth company in the life sciences technology consulting firm.', '10+ years of experience', '\xa0', 'This position can be a combination of either a business analyst or a BA/product manager\xa0with a strong tech background, or a solution architect who is a strong communicator and has a good understanding of business needs – with data engineering experience.', 'Our client is undergoing a strategic transformation intended to put the company on a growth trajectory which will make it six times its current size over next five years. The company has been building its internal teams and capabilities with \xa0new talent who would bring with them new thought process and implementation skills and make this goal achievable.', 'Self-motivated with excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills', 'This position reports to the Chief Solutions Officer and will work in very close alignment with Customer Success to make the solution a reality for the customer. This role requires the ability to interface with, and articulate systems architecture to, business users, developers, architects, IT operations professionals, and senior IT management. ', 'Ability to engage with customers to understand their needs and to work with sales and other professionals to propose solutions. ', 'Deep understanding of the Data & Analytics value chain right from data-ingestion / processing including meta data management, semantic mapping, quality etc. / insight generation and delivery / overall DataOps process.', 'This role is a remote/home-based role with travel expected in a post-Covid environment. ', 'Keen problem solving, able to rapidly ingest, absorb, synthesize and act on new information', 'Strong Experience engaging with senior leaders--both technical and business in pharma and biotech', 'Experience in RWE / HEOR and commercial is a plus', 'Experience supporting the sale of end-to-end data analytics projects or specific slivers of this value chain.', 'A bachelor’s degree is required; a master’s degree is desirable with an academic discipline in computer science, business analytics, economics (with a BA focus), etc. ', 'An end-to-end advanced solution provider, this company helps break down silos, integrates data and analytics across Omics, Clinical Trials, and RWE to uncover novel insights and opportunities. Over the last 17 years, our client and its parent company have been the preferred data and analytics partner to over 150 clients including 15 of the top 20 large Pharma. \xa0', 'In order to sustain and further grow its position in the global marketplace and sharpen its competitive edge, we are seeking to bring onboard an experienced Solution Architect / Pre-Sales professional. ', 'Ideal candidates will understand early stage R&D--mainly pre-clinical & phase 1&2 clinical trials.', 'Requirements', 'Ability to engage with customers to understand their needs and to work with sales and other professionals to propose solutions. Experience in RWE / HEOR and commercial is a plusA bachelor’s degree is required; a master’s degree is desirable with an academic discipline in computer science, business analytics, economics (with a BA focus), etc. 10+ years of experienceStrong Experience engaging with senior leaders--both technical and business in pharma and biotechExperience supporting the sale of end-to-end data analytics projects or specific slivers of this value chain.Deep understanding of the Data & Analytics value chain right from data-ingestion / processing including meta data management, semantic mapping, quality etc. / insight generation and delivery / overall DataOps process.Self-motivated with excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skillsKeen problem solving, able to rapidly ingest, absorb, synthesize and act on new informationThis position can be a combination of either a business analyst or a BA/product manager\xa0with a strong tech background, or a solution architect who is a strong communicator and has a good understanding of business needs – with data engineering experience.Ideal candidates will understand early stage R&D--mainly pre-clinical & phase 1&2 clinical trials.']

Over the years, we have run hundreds of studies and led several research and analytics projects to understand what makes digital advertising successful.', 'Effective at managing big data projects']

['', ' Responsible for issue intake and monitoring including monitoring mailbox, taking phone calls, working ITSD queues, working Jira queues (DDI), addressing walk-up inquiries, on-call support, etc.; logs request into system of record (Jira).', 'Key Responsibilities', ' 3+ years’ experience in two or more of the following: project management, product management, business analysis, program management or product marketing', 'Preferred Qualifications', ' Demonstrated experience working closely with senior leadership Experience in an agile software environment Creative thinker (be willing and able to think outside of the \\"this is what we\\\'ve always done\\" mentality)', ' Participate in weekly rotation of on-call support specific to a 24/7 plan, serving as the secondary/escalated person responsible for initial intake and triage of issues.', ' Excellent oral and written communication skills', ' Excellent time-management and organization skills', 'About Lowe’s', ' Responsible for issue assignment by identifying cross-functional partners to support the initial assignment.', ' Creative thinker (be willing and able to think outside of the \\"this is what we\\\'ve always done\\" mentality)', 'About Lowe’s In The Community', 'Required Qualifications', 'Job Summary', ' Responsible for developing skillset for business communications by learning how to document and communicate business impacts/outages/moratoriums, provide business updates on issues, and provide business updates through available communication vehicles including executive summaries, WBR and email broadcast communications.', ' Responsible for issue triage to develop and begin leveraging subject matter expertise to understand broader omni-impacts; participates in review and/or reassignment of priority based on available data for complex issues.', ' Responsible for issue coordination and management by providing scripted issue resolution with corrective actions to resolve the issue when it is easily identified and/or the resolution is known during triage (ex: cookie issue). This individual also has some autonomy to research and execute a solution without cross-functional dependency (ex: pricing, promotion, availability).', ' 1+ year(s) experience in one or more of the following: project management, product management, business analysis, program management or product marketing', ' Participate in issue backlog management to review on-going analysis and resolutions to known issues.', ' Demonstrated experience working cross-functionally in a large organization', ' Responsible for developing skillset to support the business with releases by identifying business impacts/outages, participate in demos, user acceptance testing, and accept known issues/defects when applicable.', ' Responsible for developing skillset for release support to represent the business/customer experience at critical decision points.', ' Experience in an agile software environment', ' Ability to handle high-pressure situations and dynamic environment', ' Responsible for issue resolution to communicate corrective actions to resolve when the issue is easily identified/resolution is known during triage; participates in broader issue resolutions as needed (e.g., executive level issue/senior task).', ' Responsible for issue intake and monitoring including monitoring mailbox, taking phone calls, working ITSD queues, working Jira queues (DDI), addressing walk-up inquiries, on-call support, etc.; logs request into system of record (Jira). Responsible for issue triage to develop and begin leveraging subject matter expertise to understand broader omni-impacts; participates in review and/or reassignment of priority based on available data for complex issues. Responsible for issue assignment by identifying cross-functional partners to support the initial assignment. Responsible for issue coordination and management by providing scripted issue resolution with corrective actions to resolve the issue when it is easily identified and/or the resolution is known during triage (ex: cookie issue). This individual also has some autonomy to research and execute a solution without cross-functional dependency (ex: pricing, promotion, availability). Responsible for issue communication to close the loop with the issue submitter; participates in providing input into issue communication. Responsible for issue resolution to communicate corrective actions to resolve when the issue is easily identified/resolution is known during triage; participates in broader issue resolutions as needed (e.g., executive level issue/senior task). Participate in issue backlog management to review on-going analysis and resolutions to known issues. Responsible for issue trend monitoring to proactively monitor inbound queues/available tools for actionable changes in defined KPIs. Responsible for developing skillset for release support to represent the business/customer experience at critical decision points. Responsible for developing skillset to support the business with releases by identifying business impacts/outages, participate in demos, user acceptance testing, and accept known issues/defects when applicable. Responsible for developing skillset for business communications by learning how to document and communicate business impacts/outages/moratoriums, provide business updates on issues, and provide business updates through available communication vehicles including executive summaries, WBR and email broadcast communications. ['', 'Responsibilities', 'Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance and OneMedical membership', 'With our current phase of exciting growth comes a greater demand for both quick and deep insights— and that’s where you come in.
