This individual will review QC Vendor audits, work with various counterparties to remediate loan defects, and identify key risk trends that may impact loan saleability and a counterparty’s approval to continue to sell loans into the company’s co-issue program.\xa0\xa0Additionally, this individual will also be responsible for the management of company contracts, and provide support to the Credit Risk team by assisting with the administration and maintenance of the company’s various selling guides and completing reporting requirements associated with quality control, file requests, repurchases, and other related credit functions. This position requires expert mortgage underwriting and credit knowledge, clear communication skills, outstanding customer service, and proven problem solving and common sense decision making skills, as well as advanced computer, reporting, and technical abilities. The successful candidate will have significant interaction with both internal and external parties at varying levels, and must have the ability to thrive in a fast paced environment.', 'Dental & Vision insurance', 'At Computershare we invite you to share our vision and commitment to excellence in everything that we do. Our 12,000 people around the globe are entrepreneurial and innovative, serving 16,000 clients and customers with precision and reliability because they count on us to deliver, every time.\xa0', 'We have a unique opportunity for someone to contribute their talents and strengths as a\xa0Credit Risk Analyst', 'Tuition Reimbursement', '$1,000 Employee Referral Program', "Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.", 'Strong knowledge of conventional and government mortgage underwriting guidelines.', 'A ROLE YOU WILL LOVE', 'To learn more, visit us at\xa0www.computershare.com/mycareer.', 'The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.', 'Actively participate in the Loan Review Subcommittee by completing loan-level delinquency reviews, presenting findings, recommending action plans for outstanding loan-level issues, and recording all decisions by maintaining accurate reporting.\xa0', 'Preferred:', 'Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify risk and provide recommendations and/or resolutions to minimize risk.', "Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Minimum 3+ years of mortgage experience, preferably in underwriting and/or quality control", 'Rewards and recognition programs', 'Excellent interpersonal communication skills (written and verbal) and an ability to foster internal and external business relationships to achieve needed results', 'Computershare is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\xa0Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by applicable law.', 'Assist with the development and\xa0upkeep of departmental reporting.', 'The noise level in the environment is moderate', 'Founded in 1978, Computershare is renowned for its expertise in high integrity data management, high volume transaction processing and reconciliations, payments and stakeholder engagement. Many of the world’s leading organizations use us to streamline and maximize the value of relationships with their investors, employees, creditors and customers.']

job_text: ['', ' Lead a team of Junior BAs, Testers.', ' Conducting workshop with IT/business/operations team in order to understand the AS-IS processes / requirements and suggest TO-BE processes/requirements.', 'Beaverton, OR', ' To understand the Business requirements from different business stakeholders and convert them into System Requirements in the form of User Stories and Acceptance Criteria.', ' Defining the analysis approach for projects, ensuring they meet Capgemini and customer needs for successful delivery.', ' Review analysis documents - BRD, FSD, User Stories and take stakeholder sign-off from client.', ' Experience of working in an Agile Environment.', ' Business Requirement assessment and document business processes, flows, use cases and business requirements and help in solution development and deployment.', ' Proven Domain and Business Functions expertise in Cards domain.', ' Interact with business/SMEs/Technical stakeholders, steer workshop for requirement elicitation, system impact analysis.', ' Excellent communication and customer management skills.', ' Proven Business and Technical expertise in Credit card and banking domain (BFSI) with Hands-on experience in card management systems FDR Omaha.', ' In depth knowledge of cards issuing line of business.', ' In depth knowledge of cards issuing line of business. Conducting workshop with IT/business/operations team in order to understand the AS-IS processes / requirements and suggest TO-BE processes/requirements. Business Requirement assessment and document business processes, flows, use cases and business requirements and help in solution development and deployment. Work in cross functional team environment and liaise between the development / testing teams and the client in order to cascade the requirements. Defining the analysis approach for projects, ensuring they meet Capgemini and customer needs for successful delivery. Interact with business/SMEs/Technical stakeholders, steer workshop for requirement elicitation, system impact analysis. Lead a team of Junior BAs, Testers. Review analysis documents - BRD, FSD, User Stories and take stakeholder sign-off from client. Review test strategy, test specifications ,assist in SIT and provide UAT support. To understand the Business requirements from different business stakeholders and convert them into System Requirements in the form of User Stories and Acceptance Criteria. Proven Domain and Business Functions expertise in Cards domain. Proven Business and Technical expertise in Credit card and banking domain (BFSI) with Hands-on experience in card management systems FDR Omaha. Excellent communication and customer management skills. Prior experience of working in FDR Omaha platform is a big plus. Experience of working in an Agile Environment.', ' Review test strategy, test specifications ,assist in SIT and provide UAT support.', ' Prior experience of working in FDR Omaha platform is a big plus.', ' Work in cross functional team environment and liaise between the development / testing teams and the client in order to cascade the requirements.', 'Cards Business Analyst ', 'Required Skills']

['', 'Required experience/education:', 'Our Firm', 'Work with the Director of Enterprise Data Governance and their team, as well as other business leaders on the near and long-term roadmap for two key capabilities within American Century’s data and analytics workstreams:Data Mastery and Data CurationSelf-Service Data AnalyticsCultivate an expertise on the wants and priorities of Data Owners and consumers within the two workstreams above.Educate partners in the concepts of data governance and master data and influence / encourage their support and adoption of these data capabilities .Work with Data Owners to define and have accountability to prioritize features and story backlogs that build out these capabilities, including: Requirements gathering and translation of the product vision from feature(s) into stories with clearly defined acceptance criteria. Data ingestion and output design. Internal and External data sources and integration points. Tools and technology enabling data science and business intelligence teams. Implementation strategies and planningOwn a scrum team backlog and work day-to-day with the team to lead the delivery and execution of prioritized features and story backlogs.Coordinate dependencies with other Product Owners when deliverables are dependent on another team for completion.Participate in Delivery Team demonstrations to ensure solutions are implemented that meet the intent of the vision and strategy.Serve as the knowledge resource for questions from the development team.Maintain an in-depth knowledge of all appropriate data sources and stay ahead of changes.', "Bachelor's degree in relevant field (e.g. economics, finance, computer science, mathematics) some combination of business and technology education is highly preferred or have related work experience.Minimum of 3+ years’ experience in business, engineering, technology and/or consulting.Knowledge of Agile development methodologies and business/systems analysis.Demonstrable experience with investment data sets (security master, holdings, portfolio analytics) and an ability to mine such data and produce analyses.Strong experimental approach to drive innovation in a fast-paced environment amidst uncertainty.Strong analytical, critical thinking, negotiating and problem-solving skills.Strong written/verbal communication skills with superb attention to detail, and the ability to influence others using your unique leadership skills.Solid aptitude in learning new tools and technologies to work optimally in a rapid growth environment.Ability to work on assignments independently, using a high level of judgment and initiative in resolving problems and developing recommendations.", 'Maintain an in-depth knowledge of all appropriate data sources and stay ahead of changes.', 'The Analyst will interact and collaborate with Business leaders, Product Managers and Product Owners in Investment Management, Investment Operations, and Global Products along with the development team(s), business users and other partners to understand the vision for the business and reduce risk. You will also own and maintain a product backlog that ultimately seeks to deliver data and business solutions.', 'Knowledge of Agile development methodologies and business/systems analysis.', 'We have an Enterprise Data Senior Analyst (Product Owner) opportunity that will be a member of our innovative Enterprise Data team. You will play a key role in helping to drive forward data and analytics strategic objectives. In this role, you will support efforts to use data to increase productivity and encourage stakeholders throughout the enterprise to adopt and embrace the concepts of data governance, master data, and analytics using an enterprise data platform. Other primary responsibilities are to act in the role of product owner and define and prioritize the product backlog for various investment data domains.', 'Financial Services experience', 'American Century Investments believes all individuals are entitled to equal employment opportunity and advancement opportunities without regard to race, religious creed, color, sex, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age for individuals forty years of age and older, military and veteran status, sexual orientation, and any other basis protected by applicable federal, state and local laws. ACI does not discriminate or adopt any policy that discriminates against an individual or any group of individuals on any of these bases.', 'Participate in Delivery Team demonstrations to ensure solutions are implemented that meet the intent of the vision and strategy.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Good understanding of data mastering, knowledge of ETL development and ability to prepare technical specifications will be very favorable.', 'Work with Data Owners to define and have accountability to prioritize features and story backlogs that build out these capabilities, including: Requirements gathering and translation of the product vision from feature(s) into stories with clearly defined acceptance criteria. Data ingestion and output design. Internal and External data sources and integration points. Tools and technology enabling data science and business intelligence teams. Implementation strategies and planning', 'Enterprise Data Senior Analyst (Product Owner) ', 'Headquartered in Kansas City, Mo., we also have offices located in New York; London; Hong Kong; Frankfurt; Sydney; Los Angeles; and Mountain View, Calif. (Silicon Valley).', 'Minimum of 3+ years’ experience in business, engineering, technology and/or consulting.', 'Comfort and expertise with investment data sets (security master, holdings, portfolio analytics) and an ability to mine such data and produce analyses.\xa0', "Bachelor's degree in relevant field (e.g. economics, finance, computer science, mathematics) some combination of business and technology education is highly preferred or have related work experience.", 'Privately controlled and independent, we focus solely on investment management. This empowers us to align our decisions with client expectations and concentrate on their long-term money management needs.', 'Are you interested in an Analyst role that includes product owner responsibility? Do you have experience working with data sets within the financial services industry? We may have the opportunity you have been waiting for!', 'Our culture of winning behaviors exemplifies our dedication to clients every single day. Delivering investment results enables us to distribute over 40% of our dividends—more than $1.7 billion — to the Stowers Institute for Medical Research, a 500-person, non-profit basic biomedical research organization with a controlling interest in American Century Investments. Our dividend payments provide ongoing financial support for the Institute’s work of uncovering the causes, treatments and prevention of life-threatening diseases, like cancer.', 'Strong analytical, critical thinking, negotiating and problem-solving skills.', 'American Century Investments® is a leading global asset manager focused on delivering investment results and building long-term client relationships while supporting research that can improve human health and save lives. Founded in 1958, the firm’s 1,400 employees serve financial professionals, institutions, corporations and individual investors, offering a wide range of investment strategies across a variety of investment disciplines.', 'We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. job_text: ['', 'Who are we?', 'We offer our employees a culture of flexibility while encouraging career growth in addition to competitive compensation, healthcare benefits, 401K, PTO and other advantages.', 'Must Haves and Nice to Haves:\xa0', 'We’re a Salesforce Ventures backed company, with a proprietary product that is just beginning to make inroads within our target market.\xa0Our goal is to help companies in the Wealth Management industry deliver a seamless customer experience and our talented employees and proven leadership team of industry experts are paving the way for our continued growth and success.\xa0\xa0', 'Skience transforms the way that businesses within the Financial Services industry operate by offering Salesforce focused advisory and CRM implementation services in addition to our own cloud-based, industry-leading, enterprise-class digital platform for broker-dealers and RIAs to companies in the Wealth Management sector. Our clients range from small companies to Fortune 500 businesses and we’re growing rapidly.', 'Business Analyst - Salesforce (Location: U.S. Virtual / Remote)\xa0', 'Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.', 'Up to 50% travel to client sites is required for this role.', 'Working knowledge of the Salesforce platform (e.g. having worked on Salesforce-related projects as a Business Analyst).', 'Document and communicate the results of your efforts.', 'A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.', 'A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or an MBA.A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely track record of following through on commitments.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.Working knowledge of the Salesforce platform (e.g. having worked on Salesforce-related projects as a Business Analyst).', 'Perform user acceptance testing.', 'Excellent documentation skills.', 'Why Join Us?', 'Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization communicate the results of your efforts.Effectively communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.Work closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements.Perform user acceptance testing.Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and users.', 'Work closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.', 'Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Visio.', 'The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.', 'Founded in 2001, we have grown through a reputation of doing what is right for our customers. Come see what is waiting for you here at Skience!', 'Perform requirements analysis.', 'Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions.', 'Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.', 'Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.', 'Effectively communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.', 'Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.', "What You'll Do:\xa0", 'Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.', 'Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements.', 'Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and users.', 'A track record of following through on commitments.']

job_title: Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist / Data Analyst
job_text: ['', 'Responsibilities', 'Proficiency in R, STATA, Python, and/or R Console.', 'Qualifications', 'Conduct initial reviews of Annual Budget Reviews (ABRs) submissions by partners and other performance reporting documents from partners, flagging those with significant weaknesses and/or complexities of the projects involved, require additional review and follow-up; clear ABR summaries of conclusions for P3; participate in ABR sessions or other meetings on M&E and document relevant M&E information in such sessions, at the direction of the P3 Director and/or Senior Program M&E Specialist.', 'Excellent skills in Excel spreadsheet development and maintenance.', 'Manage ACE M&E database, including tracking data entry by partners, conducting data quality checks, and generating reports on data trends with graphics.', 'Prior experience in ACE-assisted countries (Balkans, Eurasia, and Central Asia Republics) desirable.Experience supporting M&E contracts for Department of State and/or USAID missions with an implementing partner.Proficiency in R, STATA, Python, and/or R Console.', 'Minimum Requirements:', 'Master’s degree plus 5-8 years of relevant work experience in implementing enterprise-wide program monitoring systems covering the projects and programs of multiple development entities, with an emphasis on monitoring effectiveness outcome indicators for senior decision-makers.', 'About The Position', 'Demonstrated experience managing M&E databases and creating data visualizations in software such as Tableau.', 'Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively in English, both orally and in writing, generally and on technical subjects.', 'Prior experience in ACE-assisted countries (Balkans, Eurasia, and Central Asia Republics) desirable.', 'Monitor partners’ progress against M&E follow-up actions and resubmissions listed in ABRs’ Summaries of Conclusions (SOCs), alerting the P3 Director and Senior Program M&E Specialist to pending milestones and maintaining contact with such partners in regard to the fulfillments of the actions.', 'Provide technical expertise to support EUR/ACE M&E tasks including qualitative performance data collection and analysis and drafting of reports and other dissemination products.', 'Provide technical expertise to support EUR/ACE M&E tasks including qualitative performance data collection and analysis and drafting of reports and other dissemination products.Manage ACE M&E database, including tracking data entry by partners, conducting data quality checks, and generating reports on data trends with graphics.Research third party data on ACE’s country transition metrics, which are mostly open-source indexes and their rated components, and develop data visualization graphics on trends in country progress and multi-country-country comparisons.Conduct initial reviews of Annual Budget Reviews (ABRs) submissions by partners and other performance reporting documents from partners, flagging those with significant weaknesses and/or complexities of the projects involved, require additional review and follow-up; clear ABR summaries of conclusions for P3; participate in ABR sessions or other meetings on M&E and document relevant M&E information in such sessions, at the direction of the P3 Director and/or Senior Program M&E Specialist.Assist P3 in assembling evaluation contract procurement documentation, including drafting parts of statements of work at the direction of the P3 Director or his/her designee.Coordinate ACE input into annual reporting on EUR JRS indicators assigned to ACE.Draft M&E reports, policies, and procedures documents under the direction of the P3 Director and/or the Senior Program M&E Specialist, including updates to existing documents, and/or manage their clearance process, and assist in quality control review of these documents.Assist in providing training to partners on M&E, including logistics support and identifying examples of good outcome indicators in the ACE Partner Performance Trackers, and delivery of training under the direction of the P3 director and/or Senior Program M&E Specialist.Participate in Department meetings on M&E, including the evaluation community of practice and M&E events held by the Officer of the Director of Foreign Assistance and the Budget and Planning Bureau.Monitor partners’ progress against M&E follow-up actions and resubmissions listed in ABRs’ Summaries of Conclusions (SOCs), alerting the P3 Director and Senior Program M&E Specialist to pending milestones and maintaining contact with such partners in regard to the fulfillments of the actions.Some international travel may be required (~10%).Other duties as assigned.', 'Coordinate ACE input into annual reporting on EUR JRS indicators assigned to ACE.', 'Master’s degree plus 5-8 years of relevant work experience in implementing enterprise-wide program monitoring systems covering the projects and programs of multiple development entities, with an emphasis on monitoring effectiveness outcome indicators for senior decision-makers.Demonstrated experience managing M&E databases and creating data visualizations in software such as Tableau.Excellent skills in Excel spreadsheet development and maintenance.Experience researching open source indexes on country progress in democracy, governance and economic conditions, and producing analyses and graphics to help decision makers incorporate them into their decisions.Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively in English, both orally and in writing, generally and on technical subjects.Familiarity with M&E policies of the Department of State and USAID.Must currently hold a SECRET-level clearance or above.Well-organized, attentive to detail, and able to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.Demonstrated ability to problem-solve complex issues using strong analytical skills and proactively anticipate work requirements with minimal supervision.Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with a geographically and culturally diverse range of stakeholders.', 'Draft M&E reports, policies, and procedures documents under the direction of the P3 Director and/or the Senior Program M&E Specialist, including updates to existing documents, and/or manage their clearance process, and assist in quality control review of these documents.', 'Participate in Department meetings on M&E, including the evaluation community of practice and M&E events held by the Officer of the Director of Foreign Assistance and the Budget and Planning Bureau.', 'Some international travel may be required (~10%).', 'About Us', 'Assist in providing training to partners on M&E, including logistics support and identifying examples of good outcome indicators in the ACE Partner Performance Trackers, and delivery of training under the direction of the P3 director and/or Senior Program M&E Specialist.', 'Must currently hold a SECRET-level clearance or above.', 'Experience supporting M&E contracts for Department of State and/or USAID missions with an implementing partner.', 'Research third party data on ACE’s country transition metrics, which are mostly open-source indexes and their rated components, and develop data visualization graphics on trends in country progress and multi-country-country comparisons.', 'Other duties as assigned.', 'Demonstrated ability to problem-solve complex issues using strong analytical skills and proactively anticipate work requirements with minimal supervision.', 'Preferred Requirements', 'Experience researching open source indexes on country progress in democracy, governance and economic conditions, and producing analyses and graphics to help decision makers incorporate them into their decisions.', 'Well-organized, attentive to detail, and able to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.', 'Familiarity with M&E policies of the Department of State and USAID.', 'Assist P3 in assembling evaluation contract procurement documentation, including drafting parts of statements of work at the direction of the P3 Director or his/her designee.', 'Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with a geographically and culturally diverse range of stakeholders.']

['', 'About the role:', 'Collaborate, as a key member of an agile team, with Product Managers to shepherd features/user stories – guiding the discovery phase and facilitating communications amongst other team members.Analyze, organize, and document product requirements and architectural roadmap via workflows and document management tools, such as Jira, Confluence, and SharePoint.Investigate, analyze, and critique new features based on product usage data.Team with Product Managers and UI/UX designers,\xa0to outline storyboards and wireframes for interactive design of the customer-facing applications.Breakdown application features, wireframes, and workflows into stories containing logical chunks of work for assignment to developers.Write stories with clear requirements and/or acceptance criteria,\xa0containing an unambiguous definition of what “done” is, which is suitable for both software demonstrations as well as automated testing by the Quality team.Attend all agile Kanban and/or sprint meetings, including daily scrums, story reviews, bug triage, retrospectives, and product backlog grooming and prioritization.Work closely with Product, QA, Program Manager, Tech lead, Database, and support teams to plan product releases.Conduct Story Writing and Story Review sessions.Facilitate and participate in User Acceptance Testing.Contribute to release documentation and Knowledge Base.Evaluate Product enhancements by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications/features/user stories.Improve systems by studying current practices and problems, recommending suggestions for controls, procedures, modifications, and/or enhancements.Investigate, log and triage production issues and ensure defects are properly documented with steps to recreate before assigning to the development team and in some cases resolve customer issues for any data issues.', "Data analysis with data collection, organization, and identifying the correlation between analyzed data and the rest of the company's and industry's data", 'Team with Product Managers and UI/UX designers,\xa0to outline storyboards and wireframes for interactive design of the customer-facing applications.', 'Write stories with clear requirements and/or acceptance criteria,\xa0containing an unambiguous definition of what “done” is, which is suitable for both software demonstrations as well as automated testing by the Quality team.', 'Prior experience in web application and API development is highly desirable.', 'Contribute to release documentation and Knowledge Base.', 'Knowledge of database management systems including Oracle, MarkLogic, MongoDB, Aurora, or similar DBMS', 'The\xa0Senior Software Business Analyst\xa0should have a track record of successfully working in 6–8-member agile teams, analyzing product feature enhancements following agile methodology and Scrum framework. The role requires close collaboration with the Product Manager, Program Manager, UI/UX designers, Technical and Database Leads, UI and API developers, quality engineers, and performance engineers.\xa0\xa0', 'Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills', 'Knowledge of REST concepts is a plus.', 'Proficient in Agile methodology and Scrum framework for software development', 'Preferable - knowledge of the commercial construction industry', 'Work closely with Product, QA, Program Manager, Tech lead, Database, and support teams to plan product releases.', 'Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline', 'Conduct Story Writing and Story Review sessions.', 'Investigate, log and triage production issues and ensure defects are properly documented with steps to recreate before assigning to the development team and in some cases resolve customer issues for any data issues.', 'Investigate, analyze, and critique new features based on product usage data.', 'Basic and advanced database querying skills are a must.', 'It is our job to make sure construction firms have visibility to any, and all jobs they could apply for.\xa0We are the leading provider of commercial construction project data, market forecasting & analytics, and workflow integration.\xa0Our solutions are used every day by building product manufacturers, architects, engineers, contractors, and specialty trade subcontractors to identify and pursue new opportunities that will help them grow their business and workforce.\xa0\xa0', "Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline6 to 8+ years professional experience as a software business analystExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience creating functional requirements using various visual models and wireframe prototypesExperience conducting business analysis using use cases, business process models & decision modelsExperience facilitating requirements gathering sessions like requirements workshops and JAD sessionsProficient in Agile methodology and Scrum framework for software developmentExperience working on responsive page design and wireframesPrior experience in web application and API development is highly desirable.Knowledge of REST concepts is a plus.Knowledge of database management systems including Oracle, MarkLogic, MongoDB, Aurora, or similar DBMSBasic and advanced database querying skills are a must.Working knowledge of web client technologies including HTML5/CSS/JavaScript/AJAXData analysis with data collection, organization, and identifying the correlation between analyzed data and the rest of the company's and industry's dataBasic project management capabilities with a drive to meet deadlines and demonstrate resultsStrong communication skills with the ability to interface with Product and IT managementPreferable - knowledge of the commercial construction industry", 'We’re looking for great people who share our passion and vision, come join us!', 'Breakdown application features, wireframes, and workflows into stories containing logical chunks of work for assignment to developers.', 'What you’ll bring:', 'Dodge Data & Analytics is searching for a dynamic Senior Software Business Analyst to be part of the DDA Product Delivery teams.', 'Basic project management capabilities with a drive to meet deadlines and demonstrate results', 'Evaluate Product enhancements by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications/features/user stories.', 'About Dodge Data & Analytics:', 'Experience facilitating requirements gathering sessions like requirements workshops and JAD sessions', 'We do this by utilizing the latest technology to scrape the web for construction projects and ingest that content into our data platform.\xa0We then utilize master data management to define relationships amongst data elements and bring this together for our customers in an intuitive user experience, with analytics to truly challenge the art of the possible. The company’s brands include Dodge Construction Central, Dodge Global Network, Dodge Pipeline, Dodge Mobile, Dodge Business Intelligence Suite, and Sweets.', 'Facilitate and participate in User Acceptance Testing.', 'Improve systems by studying current practices and problems, recommending suggestions for controls, procedures, modifications, and/or enhancements.', 'Working knowledge of web client technologies including HTML5/CSS/JavaScript/AJAX', 'Experience creating functional requirements using various visual models and wireframe prototypes', 'Strong communication skills with the ability to interface with Product and IT management', 'What you’ll do:', 'Analyze, organize, and document product requirements and architectural roadmap via workflows and document management tools, such as Jira, Confluence, and SharePoint.', 'Attend all agile Kanban and/or sprint meetings, including daily scrums, story reviews, bug triage, retrospectives, and product backlog grooming and prioritization.', '\ufeffDodge Data & Analytics is committed to leveraging the talent of a diverse workforce to create great opportunities for our business and our people. EOE/AA. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran', 'Senior Software Business Analyst ', 'Experience conducting business analysis using use cases, business process models & decision models', 'Experience working on responsive page design and wireframes', 'Collaborate, as a key member of an agile team, with Product Managers to shepherd features/user stories – guiding the discovery phase and facilitating communications amongst other team members.', '6 to 8+ years professional experience as a software business analyst', 'At Dodge Data & Analytics (DDA), we believe construction is a critical sector of our economy.\xa0It is the engine that powers economic growth by creating a wealth of jobs throughout the industry.\xa0Unfortunately, though, for many companies in this space, construction jobs are often hard to find.\xa0This results in project delays and missed opportunities for everyone from architects to specialty trade sub-contractors.\xa0With these difficult economic times, companies, and their employees, cannot afford not to know about work.\xa0That is where we come in.']

act as “go-to” resource for other team members', 'What’s in It for You', '-Coordinating and executing testing / UAT for all accounting systems implementations', '-Leading clients through accounting/finance system implementations, migrations, upgrades, and enhancement projects; primary focus is on new implementations', '-Eliciting requirements from the clients through interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process descriptions, Use Cases, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis', '-Experience implementing and enhancing ERP systems similar in functionality to Microsoft Dynamics 365, Great Plains, NAV, or AX; i.e. Oracle, SAP, JDE, Sage, Epicor, or other comparable systems', '\xa0', "-Creating required project artifacts, including Functional Design Documents (FDD's) as well as supporting documentation, such as process flows and/or data mapping", '-Experience providing accounting and systems support to a global manufacturing/distribution company with significant inventory and warehouse considerations', 'Company Overview', '-Enjoy a hybrid schedule consisting of office / remote and travel to client sites - 50% travel estimated', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or Information Systems; certification not required', '-6-10 years of combined accounting and financial systems analyst experience', 'Required Skills', '-Join a “low ego” environment with high levels of professionalism, collaboration, and autonomy', '-Join a growing organization that provides opportunities for personal and professional growth', '-Knowledge of how cash flows and changes value through a product life-cycle', '-Consulting background or experience working as an internal consultant', '-Experience as the functional accounting leader implementing and/or supporting financial systems and applications, preferably Great Plains and Microsoft Dynamics 365 – Business Central', 'Maven Advisors has been engaged by our client to fill a Lead Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Consultant role. Manage and lead development teams to successful outcomes: identify key metrics, set milestones and timelines, assess performance, develop communication materials and allocate resources. Perform role of scrum master, ensure the team feels comfortable sharing positive and negative feelings during retrospectives. Facilitate the sprint review. Work with PO’s on grooming the backlog and remove roadblocks quickly. Participate in story estimating, ensure team creates proper subtasks and tracks their time in Jira. Present project status to senior management team. Ensure software development projects have adequate automated test coverage. Manage UAT and UXT for users.', 'Job Description', ' Create project vision documents to define the project with the help of SME’s, product owners and technical experts. job_title: Senior Analyst, Financial Planning and Analysis
job_text: ['', 'Responsibilities', ' Completion of a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or a related discipline and 5+ years of directly related experience; or an equivalent combination of training and experience related to the duties of the position. Requires experience in financial planning, budgeting, capital budgeting, forecasting, business analysis, and modeling. Excellent oral, written, influence, and interpersonal skills required. Technical competencies include Financial Planning software tools such Hyperion, Essbase, Tableau, and PeopleSoft. Must be an advanced user with Microsoft Office applications, specifically Excel and PowerPoint.', 'Develop, build, and maintain financial models/analysis. Analyze financial statements, reports and related data; develop executive-level presentations to inform and support both short term and long term planning efforts across the Association.', 'Provide direct financial planning and analysis support for various groups within CSN. Manage monthly business unit budget / forecast variance reports, identify and communicate details related to any variance issues; meet with business unit managers, discuss variances, and document / communicate related risks or opportunities. ', 'Summary', 'At AARP, the health and well-being of our candidates, employees, and members is a top priority. As a result of the COVID pandemic, all interviews will be held virtually and all non-essential employees will continue to work remotely until further notice. AARP has established social distancing policies to ensure the safety of our essential employees.', 'In depth knowledge in job-related areas of expertise.', 'Business Unit Description', 'As a member of the FP&A team, the incumbent will provide ongoing value-added financial and business analysis and support for all levels of management within AARP’s Community, State and National Affairs (CSN) group. Performs financial analysis and reporting duties, including the creation, review, and quality control of financial reports.', 'Requires minimal direction and makes decisions independently.', 'Provide ad-hoc financial analysis and business case development as required.', 'Develops forms, reports, and ad hoc analytics within Hyperion Planning, Hyperion Financial Reporting, and Smart View. Is trained extensively on all aspects of Hyperion Planning and Smart View (Essbase).', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', 'Technical competencies include Financial Planning software tools such Hyperion, Essbase, Tableau, and PeopleSoft. Must be an advanced user with Microsoft Office applications, specifically Excel and PowerPoint.', 'Responsible for coordinating the annual budget, quarterly forecasts, and monthly financial results analysis processes across multiple lines of business within the CSN group.', 'Leverage new technology to drive efficiencies in reporting, including data visualization.', 'Manage and execute special projects, ad hoc analysis, and other duties, as assigned.', ' As a member of the FP&A team, the incumbent will provide ongoing value-added financial and business analysis and support for all levels of management within AARP’s Community, State and National Affairs (CSN) group. Performs financial analysis and reporting duties, including the creation, review, and quality control of financial reports. Responsible for coordinating the annual budget, quarterly forecasts, and monthly financial results analysis processes across multiple lines of business within the CSN group. Develop, build, and maintain financial models/analysis. Analyze financial statements, reports and related data; develop executive-level presentations to inform and support both short term and long term planning efforts across the Association. Provide ad-hoc financial analysis and business case development as required. Leverage new technology to drive efficiencies in reporting, including data visualization.', 'Provide and review monthly operational and financial variance analysis, including trend analysis to provide additional insight as well as targeting improvement of forecasts, and forecast accuracy.', 'Prioritize projects and assignments efficiently and effectively. Uses business, technical, and educational experience to correctly evaluate the analytical output of others. Completes assignments in a timely manner, often while completing multiple projects with competing priorities.', 'Benefits Offered', 'Partners with business group leaders, operations staff, accounting, and other FP&A staff to coordinate the timely completion of the annual budget process, quarterly forecasts, monthly financial close, and other ad-hoc analysis projects.', ' Provide direct financial planning and analysis support for various groups within CSN. Manage monthly business unit budget / forecast variance reports, identify and communicate details related to any variance issues; meet with business unit managers, discuss variances, and document / communicate related risks or opportunities.  Develops forms, reports, and ad hoc analytics within Hyperion Planning, Hyperion Financial Reporting, and Smart View. Is trained extensively on all aspects of Hyperion Planning and Smart View (Essbase). Partners with business group leaders, operations staff, accounting, and other FP&A staff to coordinate the timely completion of the annual budget process, quarterly forecasts, monthly financial close, and other ad-hoc analysis projects. Provides training, guidance and support to a sizable group of CSN budgeters each forecast cycle. Manage and develop critical relationships across key functional areas within AARP and interacts with all levels of leadership at AARP, including the Sr. Vice President - Financial Planning & Analysis and various Executives for CSN groups. Must be comfortable working directly with Executives and Leadership Team members.  Provide and review monthly operational and financial variance analysis, including trend analysis to provide additional insight as well as targeting improvement of forecasts, and forecast accuracy. Manage and execute special projects, ad hoc analysis, and other duties, as assigned. Prioritize projects and assignments efficiently and effectively. Uses business, technical, and educational experience to correctly evaluate the analytical output of others. Completes assignments in a timely manner, often while completing multiple projects with competing priorities. Requires minimal direction and makes decisions independently. In depth knowledge in job-related areas of expertise.', 'Requirements', 'Manage and develop critical relationships across key functional areas within AARP and interacts with all levels of leadership at AARP, including the Sr. Vice President - Financial Planning & Analysis and various Executives for CSN groups. Must be comfortable working directly with Executives and Leadership Team members. ', 'Provides training, guidance and support to a sizable group of CSN budgeters each forecast cycle.', 'Completion of a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or a related discipline and 5+ years of directly related experience; or an equivalent combination of training and experience related to the duties of the position. Requires experience in financial planning, budgeting, capital budgeting, forecasting, business analysis, and modeling. Excellent oral, written, influence, and interpersonal skills required.']
